vicissim: <entryFree id="n50857" type="main" key="vi^cissim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcissim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on the other hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the contrary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in turn</hi> (freq. and class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in vicem): nunc mihi vicissim supplicabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">da te mihi vicissim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra uno tempore florere, deinde vicissim horrere potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspecto, quid ille tecum, quid tu vicissim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebebo ego me tibi vicissim attentum contra Stoicos auditorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc veniam petimusque damusque vicissim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">considera nunc vicissim tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versique vicissim Rutuli, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, fare vicissim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 531</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vicissitas: <entryFree id="n50858" type="hapax" key="vi^cissi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcissĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alternation</hi>, = vicissitudo: vicissitatemque imperandi tradidit, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 185, 18</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 181 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
vicissitudo: <entryFree id="n50859" type="main" key="vi^cissi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcissĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vicis, I.</etym>, <sense id="n50859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interchange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alternation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicissitude</hi> (class.; used alike in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum vicissitudo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alio in aliud vicissitudo atque mutatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sermone communi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:134" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 37, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil vicissitudine studiorum officiorumque jucundius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum (generum),</quote> <trans><tr>reciprocal influence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 84</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dierum noctiumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diurnae nocturnaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae (with temporum varietates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternae digitorum vicissitudines,</quote> <trans><tr>the interlocking of the fingers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
victa: <entryFree id="n50860" type="main" key="Victa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Victa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. victus</etym>, <sense id="n50860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess that presides over food</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
victima: <entryFree id="n50861" type="main" key="victi^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victĭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. root vig- of vigeo; with superl. ending; cf. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 509 sq.</etym>, <sense id="n50861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beast for sacrifice</hi> adorned with the fillet (vitta), <hi rend="ital">a sacrifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victim</hi> (cf. hostia). </sense><sense id="n50861.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:335" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 335</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:113" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 611</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 923 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 923 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50861.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a victim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam potestis P. Lentulo mactare victimam gratiorem quam si L. Flacci sanguine illius nefarium in nos omnes odium saturaveritis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 38, 95</bibl></cit>: se victimam rei publicae<cb n="VICT" />  praebere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victima deceptus decipientis ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me nuptiali victimam feriat die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 348" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 348</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
victimarius: <entryFree id="n50862" type="main" key="victi^ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victĭmārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>victima</etym>, <sense id="n50862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to victims.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50862.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiator,</quote> <trans><tr>a dealer in beasts for sacrifice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 54</bibl></cit> (al. suarius).—</sense><sense id="n50862.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">victĭmārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n50862.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An assistant at sacrifices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 29, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2453 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3644</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50862.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A dealer in beasts for sacrifice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:14:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 14, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
victimo: <entryFree id="n50863" type="main" key="victi^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victĭmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to offer in sacrifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sacrifice</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hircum Marti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 192, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 197, 31: <cit><quote lang="la">filium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 34, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
victito: <entryFree id="n50864" type="main" key="victi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>vivo</etym>, <sense id="n50864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to live</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subsist</hi> on any thing (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ficis victitamus aridis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 59</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sinapi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suco suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene libenter,</quote> <trans><tr>to live freely</tr>, <tr>live high</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
victor: <entryFree id="n50865" type="main" key="victor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vinco</etym>. <sense id="n50865.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a conqueror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanquisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victor.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50865.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n50865.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (sc. stipendium) victores victis imponere consuērint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa victori, eorum arbitrio, per quos vicit, etiam invito facienda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50865.3" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium gentium victor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille exercitus tot divitissimarum gentium victor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atheniensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:7" default="NO">3, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:4" default="NO">6, 6, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 10, 6.—Esp., with belli or bellorum: ut meus victor vir belli clueat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus belli (i. e. cum Antiocho) victor L. Scipio laudem adsumpsit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victores bellorum civilium vincere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Camillus trium simul bellorum victor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paulum tanti belli victorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 36, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:55:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 55, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:625" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 625</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedones, tot bellorum in Europā victores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 58</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis generis certaminum (Hercules),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pancratii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50865.4" n="3" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum civili bello victor iratus respondit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:19:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello civili victores victosque numquam coalescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 7</bibl></cit> Halm (Ritter, belli civilis).—</sense><sense id="n50865.5" n="B" level="2"> Fig. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): animus libidinis et divitiarum victor,</quote> <trans><tr>master of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 63, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victor propositi,</quote> <trans><tr>successful in</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50865.6" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n50865.7" n="A" level="2"> Victor, <hi rend="ital">the Conquering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Victorious</hi>, an epithet of Jupiter, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 23, 8 sq.</bibl>—Of Hercules, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 8, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50865.8" n="B" level="2"> In appos., = vincens, <hi rend="ital">superior.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50865.9" n="1" level="3"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">victorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquering</hi> (cf. Zumpt, § 102, n. 2; Madv. § 60, obs. 2). </sense><sense id="n50865.10" n="a" level="4"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum exercitum victorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pejus victoribus Sequanis, quam Aeduis victis accidisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galli (aves) victi silere solent, canere victores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 26, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victores Graii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 605</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 329</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 409</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 565</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 437</bibl>.—Esp., with discedo, abeo, redeo, revertor, etc. (= the more freq. superior discedo, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">victores victis hostibus legiones reveniunt domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meminerant ad Alesiam magnam se inopiam perpessos ... maximarum gentium victores discessisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita certe inde abiere Romani ut victores, Etrusci pro victis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 19, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi victores se redituros ex hac pugnā jurant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 45, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victores reverterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7:1" default="NO">8, 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50865.11" n="b" level="4"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">victor virtute fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50865.12" n="2" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">abstulit has (sc. naves) ... Aestus, et obnixum victor detrusit in Austrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 334</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50865.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a conqueror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triumphal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in curru, Caesar, victore veheris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50866" type="main" key="Victor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Victor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: S. Aurelius, <sense id="n50866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman historian of the fourth century</hi> A.D., <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 10, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
victoria: <entryFree id="n50867" type="main" key="victo_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>victor</etym>. <sense id="n50867.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">victory.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50867.1" n="A" level="2"> In war. </sense><sense id="n50867.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: cernere de victoriā, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 511, 9</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 206 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">insignia victoriae, non victoriam reportare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus plus victoriae quam praedae deportavit,</quote> <trans><tr>prestige</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reverti cum victoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concurritur: horae Momento cita mors venit aut victoria laeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: illum diem omnes labores et victorias confirmaturum,<cb n="VICT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50867.3" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: utrl magni victoria sit dati regni, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 108</bibl> (Ann. v. 91 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">extremum malorum omnium esse civilis belli victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementiam in victoriā belli civilis admirabilem exhibuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.—Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec bella gravissima victoriaeque eorum bellorum clarissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 14, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50867.4" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Canulejus victoriā de patribus ... ingens esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africanus ob egregiam victoriam de Hannibale Poenisque appellatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 46, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39:17" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 39, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Vejentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantaecumque, de Romanis tamen, victoriae partae fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippi de Atheniensibus victoriam praeferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 3, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50867.5" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ab illo insignia victoriae, non victoriam reportarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50867.6" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens una populi Romani saepe ex opulentissimā Etruscā civitate victoriam tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Campanis victoriam pepererunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 34, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Domitii ex Arvernis victoria fuit nobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:10:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50867.7" n="B" level="2"> In law contests, etc. </sense><sense id="n50867.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria penes patres fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex collegā victoriam quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:811" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 811</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 539</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50867.9" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 12, § 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50867.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50867.11" n="A" level="2"> Personified: Victoria, as a Roman goddess, <hi rend="ital">Victory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neptunus, Virtus, Victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 43, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 387</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1803</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1838</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 62</bibl> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n50867.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A battle-cry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shout of victory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo more victoriam conclamant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 37</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50867.13" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A statue of Victory;</hi> in a lusus verbb.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam qui Victorias aureas in usum belli conflari volebat, ita declinavit, victoriis utendum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
victorialis: <entryFree id="n50868" type="main" key="victo_ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victōrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>victoria</etym>, <sense id="n50868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to victory</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n50868.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: dies, <hi rend="ital">day of victory</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">when victories are celebrated</hi>, Treb. Gall. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">scipio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50868.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">victōrĭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> Idaea Daphne, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 10, 210</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
victoriatus: <entryFree id="n50869" type="main" key="victo_ri^a_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victōrĭātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (i. e. nummus) [Victoria]. <sense id="n50869.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A silver coin stamped with the image of Victory</hi>, = quinarius; <cit><quote lang="la">in Varro's time worth half a denarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=41" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 41</bibl></cit> Vahl.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50869.1" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">an apothecaries' weight</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 28:26" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 28, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50870" type="main" key="victo_ri^a_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victōrĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [victoria], <sense id="n50870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gained by victory</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">plus victoriatum est quam injuriatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
victoriola: <entryFree id="n50871" type="main" key="Victo_ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Victōrĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>victoria, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n50871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little statue of Victory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
victoriosus: <entryFree id="n50872" type="main" key="victo_ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victōrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>victoria</etym>, <sense id="n50872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">victorious</hi> (ante- and post-class.; cf. victor, II. B.), Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 12</bibl>.—As an epithet of the emperor Probus, Nummus ap. Eckhel. D. N. V. 7, p. 505.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">PRINCIPES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 170, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1045</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
victrix: <entryFree id="n50873" type="main" key="victrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victrix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> victrice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 7 al.</bibl>; <sense id="n50873.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">but victrici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> victricium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victricum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=178:26" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 178, 26</bibl></cit>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>victor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">she that is victorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a conqueress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victress; adj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victorious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50873.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">victrices Athenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus victrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 37, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victricia arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 54</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:5:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae, Auct. B. Alex. 40: naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:ib. 11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>; 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:754" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 754</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:739" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 739</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:421" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:150" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>containing news of victory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat victrix res publica caesis Antonii copiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 882</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50873.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater victrix filiae non libidinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victrix causa deis placuit, sed victa Catoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea (Alecto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 544</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 283</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
victualis: <entryFree id="n50874" type="main" key="victu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. victus</etym>, <sense id="n50874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to nourishment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sustenance</hi> (postclass.). </sense><sense id="n50874.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministerium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 51, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50874.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">victŭālia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">provisions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victuals</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
victuarius: <entryFree id="n50875" type="main" key="victu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sustenance</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exhibitio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of provisions</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 8</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1988" /> <cb n="VIDE" /></sense></entryFree>
victus: <entryFree id="n50876" type="main" key="victus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of vinco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50877" type="main" key="victus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">victus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (ante-class. collat. form of the <sense id="n50877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> victuis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 494, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 75</bibl></cit>; also cited ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 484, 10</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vivo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n50877.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That upon which one lives; sustenance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nourishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provisions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victuals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis victus cultusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 23</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 53</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> victu, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:16:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 158</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:104 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 104 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50877.2" n="B" level="2"> In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">necessaries of life</hi>, inclusive of clothing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:43" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:44" default="NO">50, 16, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50877.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A way of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mode of living</hi>, with reference to the necessities of life (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vita): in victu considerare oportet, apud quos et quo more et cujus arbitratu sit educatus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 25, 35</bibl></cit>: consuetudo victūs, <hi rend="ital">manner of living</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subsisting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quali igitur victu sapiens utetur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 63</bibl></cit>.—Esp., with <hi rend="ital">vita</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaius Tuditanus, omni vitā atque victu excultus atque expolitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:25:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego autem nobilium vitā victuque mutato mores mutari civitatem puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidus non minus in vitā quam victu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viculus: <entryFree id="n50878" type="main" key="vi_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>vicus</etym>, <sense id="n50878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little village</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hamlet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vicus: <entryFree id="n50879" type="main" key="vi_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. vēcas, vēcman, house; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">oi)=kos</foreign>; O. H. Germ. wīch, village; and Engl. -wick or -wich, as in Berwick, Norwich</etym>. <sense id="n50879.0" n="I" level="1"> Collectively, <hi rend="ital">a row of houses</hi> in town or country, <hi rend="ital">a quarter</hi> of a city, <hi rend="ital">a street</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 24, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 228</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 269</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:610 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 610 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50879.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A village</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hamlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a country-seat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis Cobiamacho, qui vicus inter Tolosam et Narbonem est, deverterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 30, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 177 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
videlicet: <entryFree id="n50880" type="main" key="vi^de_li^cet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdēlĭcet</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from videre licet; cf. scilicet from scire licet; v. scilicet <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; prop. it is easy to see, to comprehend</etym>, serving, like scilicet, to confirm and complete what precedes (but with the difference that scilicet indicates rather the false, and videlicet the true explanation; v. Zumpt, Lat. Gram. § 345 n.); <sense id="n50880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">it is easy to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is clear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evidently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifestly</hi>, etc. (class., but much less freq. than scilicet). </sense><sense id="n50880.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50880.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n50880.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi> on account of videre (only ante- and post-class.; for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 11, 7</bibl>, the better read. is datae): <cit><quote lang="la">videlicet, parcum illum fuisse senem, qui dixerit ... Videlicet fuisse illum nequam adulescentem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 49</bibl></cit> and 51: <cit><quote lang="la">esse videlicet in terris primordia rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed videlicet, eum vocabula rerum ignoravisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50880.4" n="(b)" level="5"> As a mere particle: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc enim est Negotiosus interdius: videlicet Solon est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videlicet propter divitias inditum id nomen quasi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic de nostris verbis errat videlicet, Quae hic sumus locuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae videlicet ille non ex agri consiturā, sed ex doctrinae indiciis interpretabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil dolo factum, ac magis calliditate Jugurthae, cui videlicet speculanti iter suum cognitum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 107:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 107, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50880.5" n="(g)" level="5"> Ellipt., in replies: <cit><quote lang="la">quid metuebant? Vim videlicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid horum se negat fecisse? Illud videlicet unum, quod necesse est, pecuniam accepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:33:section=80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 33, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eorum ... quorum? Videlicet qui supra scripti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:54:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 54, 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50880.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">it is easy to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is very plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forsooth</hi>, in an ironical or sarcastic sense, when the contrary is intended: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus videlicet salutaris consulatus, perniciosus meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo videlicet timidus et permodestus (Catilina) vocem consulis ferre non potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque censuit pecunias eorum publicandas, videlicet timens, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50880.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a mere complementary or explanatory particle, <hi rend="ital">to wit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">namely</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas scilicet in this sense is only post-Aug.): caste jubet lex adire ad deos, animo videlicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: venisse tempus iis, qui in timore <cb n="VIDE" /> fuissent, conjuratos videlicet dicebat, ulciscendi se, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 12, 28</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale de Homero scribit Ennius, de quo videlicet saepissime vigilans solebat cogitare et loqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viden: <entryFree id="n50881" type="main" key="vi^den'?"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭden'?</orth> v. video <sense id="n50881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
videns: <entryFree id="n50882" type="main" key="vi^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophet</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">eamus ad videntem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samuel videns,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Par. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gad videns et Nathan propheta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:29:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Par. 29, 25</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
video: <entryFree id="n50883" type="main" key="vi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>vīdi, vīsum, 2</itype> (viden', i.e. videsne, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:17" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 779</bibl>; <sense id="n50883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> viderier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:53:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 53, 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidĕ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 46</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root vid-, vēda, know; vindāmi, find; cf. vēda-s, sacred book; Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">i)d, vid-</foreign>, in <foreign lang="greek">ei)=don</foreign>, saw; <foreign lang="greek">oi)=da</foreign>, know; Germ. wissen; Engl. wit, wot</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>, with the eyes (syn. cerno). </sense><sense id="n50883.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50883.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Tun' me vidisti? <hi rend="ital">Sc.</hi> Atque his quidem oculis. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Carebis, credo, Qui plus vident, quam quod vident. <hi rend="ital">Sc.</hi> Numquam hercle deterrebor, Quin viderim id quod viderim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:15 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 15 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clare oculis video,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos enim ne nunc quidem oculis cernimus ea, quae videmus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Considium, quod non vidisset, pro viso sibi renuntiasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres et pueri qui visum processerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut juvat pastas oves Videre properantes domum! Videre fessos vomerem inversum boves Collo trahentes languido!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:62 sq" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 62 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes atque videres Infernas errare canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 35</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ind.</hi> (poët.): <cit><quote lang="la">viden', ut geminae stant vertice cristae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 779</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viden' ut faces Splendidas quatiunt comas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 77</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne vides, ut tota tremor pertemptet equorum Corpora?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne vides ut ... Antennae gemant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sol sex mensibus continuis non videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a se disertos visos esse multos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, praef. § 13; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulis ante pedes ire viderer eques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 18</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to see</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to have the eyes open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be awake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 21</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.: De.</hi> Vide sis modo etiam. <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Visum'st, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50883.4" n="a" level="4"> Of things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">to see</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Apenninus) Gallica rura videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et casus abies visura marinos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to experience</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.5" n="b" level="4"> Of places, etc., <hi rend="ital">to look out on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afford a view of</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">triclinium hortum et gestationem videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.6" n="c" level="4"> Of the other senses, <hi rend="ital">to perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">vidistin' toto sonitus procurrere caelo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit> (3, 8), 49: <cit><quote lang="la">mugire videbis Sub pedibus terram et descendere montibus ornos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum videres Stridere secretā divisos aure susurros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naso poljam haec quidem videt plus quam oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to see</hi> on purpose, <hi rend="ital">to look at</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">vide sis signi quid siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 155</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vide, tali ubi sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud vide, os ut sibi distorsit carnufex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide, si non os inpudens Videtur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">specta me, a threatening expression,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 19 al.</bibl></cit>: quin tu me vides? <hi rend="ital">only look at me!</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">see what I have done!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50883.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to see</hi> with the mind's eye, <hi rend="ital">to perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be aware</hi>, <hi rend="ital">know</hi>, etc. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. percipio): ad te, ut video, comminus accessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem exitum ego tam video animo, quam ea, quae oculis cernimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperte enim adulantem nemo non videt,</quote> <trans><tr>sees through</tr>, <tr>detects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dormientes aliquid animo videre videamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 40, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in somnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:71:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 71, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego, cur nolim, nihil video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne vobis videtur is animus qui plus cernat et longius, videre se ad meliora proficisci: ille autem cui obtusior est acies non videre?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plus</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut is qui illusus sit plus vidisse videatur,</quote> <trans><tr>to have seen farther</tr>, <tr>had more insight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videre acutius atque acrius vitia in dicente quam recta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena melius videre et dijudicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 97</bibl></cit> (95): cum me vidisse plus <cb n="VIDE" /> fateretur, se speravisse meliora, <hi rend="ital">that I had seen farther</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 39</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem vos plus in re publicā vidistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos universos in consule deligendo plurimum vidisse fateantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 37, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di vatesque eorum in futurum vident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—With two <hi rend="ital">accs.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem virum Crassum vidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 17, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">officiorum conjunctione me privatum videbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum invidiosum se propter nimias opes viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ind.</hi> (poët.): <cit><quote lang="la">nonne vides, croceos ut Tmolus odores, India mittit ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 56</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50883.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50883.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to think</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reflect upon</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reputo, considero): duae condiciones sunt: utram tu accipias, vide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ea videamus, quae contra ab his disputari solent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id primum videamus, quātenus amor in amicitiā progredi debeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed videamus Herculem ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit> Klotz ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem et haec videnda et pecuniae fugienda cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 20, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te moneo: videas etiam atque etiam et consideres, quid agas, quo progrediare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:68:section=174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 68, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legi Bruti epistolam non prudenter rescriptam: sed ipse viderit,</quote> <trans><tr>let him see to that himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 371</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 43</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam id recte faciam, viderint sapientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (ars) quam sit facilis, illi viderint, qui, etc.... deinde etiam tu ipse videris, qui eam artem facilem esse dicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viderint ista officia viri boni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 17, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look out for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">see to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque idem (sapiens) ita acrem in omnis partis aciem intendit, ut semper videat sedem sibi ac locum sine molestiā vivendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antecesserat Statius, ut prandium nobis videret,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>provide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulciculae potionis aliquid videamus et cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud lenius (vinum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippum dixisse constabat, videndum sibi aliud esse consilium, illo senatu se rem publicam gerere non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absque eo esset, Recte ego mihi vidissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">see to it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make sure</hi>, with final clause: <cit><quote lang="la">navem idoneam ut habeas, diligenter videbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">videret, ut quam primum tota res transigeretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne fortuna mea desit, videte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videndum est, ne absit benignitas ... tum, ut pro dignitate cuique tribuatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Latine loquamur, non solum videndum est ut verba efferamus ea, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos videte, quid aliae faciant isto loco feminae: et ne, cum velitis, exire non liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.14" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To see</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50883.15" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui suo toto consulatu somnum non viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.16" n="b" level="4"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">live to see</hi> a period or event: <cit><quote lang="la">ex multis diebus, quos in vitā celeberrimos laetissimosque viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam eum diem videam, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duxi uxorem: quam ibi miseriam vidi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spero multa vos liberosque vestros in re publicā bona esse visuros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 28, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multas jam summorum imperatorum clarissimas victorias aetas nostra vidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum pro! degeneramus a parentibus nostris, ut praeter quam oram illi Punicas vagari classes dedecus esse imperii sui duxerint, eam nos nunc plenam hostium jam factam videamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 14, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.17" n="5" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to see</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">go to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visit</hi> (colloq.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">viso, inviso): sed Septimium vide et Laenatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā re etiam Othonem vide,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbis ergo hominem, si voles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mane videas Plinium domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to receive attention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be visited</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50883.18" n="6" level="3"> Me vide, <hi rend="ital">rely on me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trust me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">believe me</hi>, a formula of exhortation and assurance (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 79</bibl> Brix ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 23</bibl> Lorenz ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.19" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be looked upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">regarded</hi> in any manner, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to seem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi> to be or do any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam periculi fugā committendum est, ut imbelles timidique videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1989" /> <cb n="VIDE" /> 24, 83: <cit><quote lang="la">ne id, quod speciem haberet honesti, pugnaret cum eo, quod utile videretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo rem turpiorem fore et iniquiorem visum iri intellegebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo illorum beata mors videtur, horum vita laudabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>.—Parenthet. (cf. c. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">cum ceteris, ut quidem videor, tum mihi ipse displiceo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea vocabula non, ut videntur, easdem res significant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 34, 84</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat. of pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera, quae quibusdam admirabilia videntur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digna mihi res cum omnium cognitione tum nostrā familiaritate visa est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idonea mihi Laelii persona visa est, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a naturā mihi videtur potius quam ab indigentiā orta amicitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae Aristoni et Pyrrhoni omnino visa sunt pro nihilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod idem Scipioni videbatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—Parenthet. (cf. c. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">quam nostris libris satis diligenter, ut tibi quidem videmur, expressimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philargyrus omnia de te, ut mihi quidem visus est, narravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.20" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de familiari illo tuo videor audisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:21:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 21, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis facere rei publicae videmur, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut beate vixisse videar, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem e mundo tollere videntur, qui amicitiam e vitā tollunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videre jam videor populum a senatu disjunctum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te vero, Caecili, quem ad modum sit elusurus, videre jam videor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere videor posse contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire videor undique congerentes nomina poëtarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 61</bibl> (69), 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:17:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 17, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat. of pers.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videor mihi perspicere ipsius animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mihi videor videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:57:171" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 57, 171</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50883.21" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut exstinctae potius amicitiae quam oppressae esse videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tamquam a praesentibus coram haberi sermo videretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (sapientia) videtur in hominem cadere posse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26, 100</bibl></cit>: visus 'st in somnis pastor ad me adpellere, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Aratus ab Jove incipiendum putat, ita nos rite coepturi ab Homero videmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 46</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat. of pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitior mihi et affluentior videtur esse vera amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.22" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">creditur, in the same constr., and dicitur): non mihi videtur, ad beate vivendum satis posse virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis videtur, non incohatam sed perfectam probationem hoc nomen accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 5</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vult videri, se esse prudentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia videbatur et Limnaeam eodem tempore oppugnari posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 13, 9</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed mihi contra ea videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seque facile, ut mihi videtur, expediunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 66</bibl></cit>;
