<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.23" n="b" level="4"> In official decisions, as a guarded opinion instead of a positive declaration: <cit><quote lang="la">majores nostri voluerunt, quae jurati judices cognovissent, ea non ut esse facta, sed ut videri pronuntiarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecisse videri pronuntiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:6:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 6, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pontifices decressent, videri posse sine religione eam partem areae mihi restitui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul adjecit Senatusconsultum, Ambraciam non videri vi captam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 44, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionis sententiam sequuntur, uti ante certam diem Caesar exercitum dimittat: si non faciat, eum adversus rempublicam facturum videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50883.24" n="c" level="4"> Pregn., videtur (alicui), <hi rend="ital">it seems proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it seems good</hi> to any one; <hi rend="ital">he</hi> (<hi rend="ital">she</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">pleases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likes.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50883.25" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat. of pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi si videbitur, villis iis utere, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim Lentulum puerum visas eique de mancipiis, quae tibi videbitur, attribuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui imitamur, quos cuique visum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consul, quem videretur ei, cum imperio mitteret, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 20, 4</bibl>: si ei videretur, integram rem ad senatum reiceret, <hi rend="ital">if he pleased</hi>, a formula of politeness, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 16, 4</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; <cit><quote lang="la">31, 4, 2: ut, si videretur ei, maturaret venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 46, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50883.26" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi visum est, sub vesperum dispersi discedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58</bibl></cit>: eam <cb n="VIEN" /> quoque, si videtur, correctionem explicabo, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc, si videtur, hoc, illud alias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">M.</hi> Num non vis audire, etc.? <hi rend="ital">A.</hi> Ut videtur, <hi rend="ital">as you will</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 25, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 22, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vidualis: <entryFree id="n50884" type="main" key="vi^du^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vidua</etym>, <sense id="n50884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a widow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">widow-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitia, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 26: depeculator depositi vidualis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 40, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viduatus: <entryFree id="n50885" type="hapax" key="vi^du^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>viduo</etym>, <sense id="n50885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">widowhood</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viduertas: <entryFree id="n50886" type="hapax" key="vi^du^ertas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭertas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>viduus</etym>, <sense id="n50886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lack of fruits of the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dearth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sterility</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=369" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 369</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
viduitas: <entryFree id="n50887" type="main" key="vi^du^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bereavement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lack.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n50887.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium copiarum atque opum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50887.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">widowhood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 291, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vidularia: <entryFree id="n50888" type="main" key="Vidulari^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vidularĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a lost comedy by Plautus.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vidulus: <entryFree id="n50889" type="main" key="vidu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vidŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a travelling-trunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portmanteau</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wallet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:60 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 60 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 86</bibl>; 4, 4, 89 sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viduo: <entryFree id="n50890" type="main" key="vi^du^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>viduus</etym>, <sense id="n50890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bereave</hi> of any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n50890.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">civibus urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornos foliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva pruinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem pristino alimento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna (Plutonis) lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:601" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dexteram ense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 866" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 866</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:385" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritum amplexibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 154, 38</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">architectus ingeni viduatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orba pedum partim, manuum viduata vicissim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 840</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50890.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bereft of her husband</hi>, <hi rend="ital">widowed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippina viduata morte Domitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:31:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 31, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux viduata taedis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>divorced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 581" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 581</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viduus: <entryFree id="n50891" type="main" key="vi^du^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. vidhava, without a husband; cf. ve- in vecors, etc.; <foreign lang="greek">h)i/+qeos</foreign>, single</etym>, <sense id="n50891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deprived</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bereft of a husband</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bereft of a lover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spouseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mateless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">widowed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50891.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (Penelopa) tam diu vidua viro suo caruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidui viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 8, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidve tibi prodest viduas dormire puellas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit> (3, 31), 17.—</sense><sense id="n50891.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a widow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nupta, vidua, virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitor viduarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbarum et viduarum tributa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viduas avaras venari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>.—Of unmarried women: <cit><quote lang="la">se rectius viduam et illum caelibem futurum fuisse contendere quam cum impari jungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 245" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 245</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 215" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Med. 215</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:242:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 242, § 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50891.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50891.4" n="A" level="2"> Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">columba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 34, 52, § 104</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50891.5" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">torus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 19, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus (Penelopes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelibatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">So of a vine which is not trained to any tree, which stands alone: ut vidua in nudo vitis quae nascitur arvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 49</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and conversely, of trees which are without vines: et vitem viduas ducit ad arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">platanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:31" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 31</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50891.6" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">deprived</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bereft of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destitute of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without</hi> any thing (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose); constr. with <hi rend="ital">a</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, the simple <case>abl.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogor adire lacus viduos a lumine Phoebi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ipse viduus (i. e. viribus meis), Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 10, 25: viduus pharetrā Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alni (i. e. naves) moderantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:13" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavus (gubernatore),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:5" default="NO">3, 11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabulationes pecudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viduus mente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 120, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec viduum pectus amoris habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viduus teli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:247" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 247</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae,</quote> <trans><tr>desolate</tr>, <tr>without fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 155, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viduvium: <entryFree id="n50892" type="main" key="vi^du^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭdŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>viduus</etym>, <sense id="n50892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">widowhood</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 2</bibl>; Inscr. Don. cl. 10, n. 51.</sense></entryFree>
vienna: <entryFree id="n50893" type="main" key="Vi^enna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭenna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">on the Rhodanus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Vienne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 4, 5, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:88:2 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 88, 2 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭennensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> <cb n="VIGI" /> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Vienne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭennenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Vienne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:121" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:57 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 57 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
vieo: <entryFree id="n50894" type="main" key="vi^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭĕo</orth>, no <sense id="n50894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ētum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root in Sanscr. vjā-, cover; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)/tus</foreign>, border; cf. Lat. vitex, vitta, vimen, vitis, etc.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">twist together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weave</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">viere vincire: a quo est in Sota Ennii: Ibant malaci viere Veneriam corollam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 62</bibl></cit> Müll. (<bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 164</bibl> Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 189, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut habeas vimina, unde viendo quid facias, ut sirpeas, vallos, crates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 5</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭētus</orth> (per synæresin scanned as a dissyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 7</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, prop., <hi rend="ital">bent together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent up;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">shrunken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrivelled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrinkled</hi> (cf. viesco): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid vietum et caducum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <trans><tr>decayed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 385</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viesco: <entryFree id="n50895" type="hapax" key="vi^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭesco</orth>, <itype>cĕre</itype>, <sense id="n50895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [vieo], <hi rend="ital">to shrink up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrivel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wither</hi> (cf. vietus): <cit><quote lang="la">viescens ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vietor: <entryFree id="n50896" type="main" key="vi^e_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭētor</orth>, v. vitor.</entryFree>
vietus: <entryFree id="n50897" type="main" key="vi^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>vieo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
vigeni: <entryFree id="n50898" type="main" key="vi_ge_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, v. viceni.</entryFree>
vigeo: <entryFree id="n50899" type="main" key="vi^ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. ugras, mighty; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(gih/s</foreign>, sound; cf. Lat. vegeo, vigil, augeo</etym>, <sense id="n50899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be lively</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vigorous; to thrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bloom; to be in honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repute</hi>, etc. (class.; mostly of things, concrete and abstract; cf. valeo). </sense><sense id="n50899.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae a terrā stirpibus continentur, arte naturae vivunt et vigent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sentit, quod sapit, quod vivit, quod viget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:27:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 27, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive occiderit animus sive vigeat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vegetum ingenium in vivido pectore vigebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volsci fessi ... Romani vigentes corporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 30, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus Laetitiā viget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos animo duntaxat vigemus, etiam magis quam cum florebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriā vigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viget aetas, animus valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama Mobilitate viget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec viget quicquam simile aut secundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: cujus facta viva nunc vigent, Naev. ap <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigebant studia rei militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia, largitio, avaritia vigebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: tui politici libri omnes vigent, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl>: quem (Philonem) in Academiā maxime vigere audio, i. e. <hi rend="ital">is in the highest repute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:28:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 28, 110</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Harmodius in ore et Aristogito ... viget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regum conciliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50899.2" n="II" level="1"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to live</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be alive</hi>: Persarum vigui rege beatior. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab tergo Alpes urgent, vix integris vobis ac vigentibus transitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vigesco: <entryFree id="n50900" type="main" key="vi^gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgesco</orth>, <itype>gŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n50900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [vigeo], <hi rend="ital">to become lively</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vigorous; to thrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to flourish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bloom</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">de niloque renata vigescere copia rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 674</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:757" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 757</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam laeti studio pedes vigescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 46, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrae tum arae, vestrae religiones viguerunt, vestra vis valuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 31, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu legiones Caesaris viguerunt, nunc vigent Pansae, vigent Hirtii, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summis honoribus et multā eloquentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vigesimus: <entryFree id="n50901" type="main" key="vi_ge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. vicesimus.</entryFree>
vigessis: <entryFree id="n50902" type="main" key="vi_gessis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgessis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>viginti-as</etym>, <sense id="n50902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twenty</hi> asses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:76:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 76, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 737</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigies: <entryFree id="n50903" type="spur" key="vi_gi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgĭes</orth>, <itype>a false reading for vicies</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 597</bibl> Kopp ad loc.</entryFree>
vigil: <entryFree id="n50904" type="main" key="vi^gil"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgil</orth>, <itype>ĭlis</itype> (<sense id="n50904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> vigilium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 33, 6</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vigeo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">awake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alert</hi> (class.; cf.: insomnis, exsomnis). </sense><sense id="n50904.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50904.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius orto Sole vigil calamum et chartas et scrinia posco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilum canum excubiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the cock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 148</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">wakeful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watchful</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>always burning</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucernae,</quote> <trans><tr>night-lamps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri vigili bibere,</quote> <trans><tr>wakeful</tr>, <tr>listening</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50904.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgil</orth>, <itype>ĭlis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a watchman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentinel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor a vigilibus fanique custodibus tollitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 33, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 370</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 195</bibl></cit>.— <pb n="1990" /> <cb n="VIGI" /> Of such vigiles there were in Rome, from the time of Augustus, seven divisions, with their prefects and sub-prefects, constituting a regularly organized night-police, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:56" default="NO">47, 2, 56</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sentinel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi (sol et luna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1436</bibl></cit> (1434).—Of cocks: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50904.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <trans><tr>wakeful</tr>, <tr>active</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 396</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">questus,</quote> <trans><tr>uttered by night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:196" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 196</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vigilabilis: <entryFree id="n50905" type="hapax" key="vi^gi^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vigilo</etym>, <sense id="n50905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wakeful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watchful</hi>: dormitio nostri pectoris, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 100, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigilans: <entryFree id="n50906" type="main" key="vi^gi^lans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of vigilo.</entryFree>
vigilanter: <entryFree id="n50907" type="main" key="vi^gi^lanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vigilo, <sense id="n50907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vigilantia: <entryFree id="n50908" type="main" key="vi^gi^lanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vigilans, from vigilo</etym>, <sense id="n50908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wakefulness</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n50908.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat (Plinii) incredibile studium, summa vigilantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—Jocosely: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit (Caninius) mirificā vigilantiā, qui suo toto consulatu somnum non viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 1</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n50908.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">watchful attention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watchfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilance</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedulitas, diligentia): Siciliam virtute istius et vigilantiā singulari ... tutam esse servatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 24, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 25, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigilate: <entryFree id="n50909" type="main" key="vi^gi^la_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vigilo <sense id="n50909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
vigilatio: <entryFree id="n50910" type="main" key="vi^gi^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vigilo</etym>, <sense id="n50910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wakefulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleeplessness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:101" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigilax: <entryFree id="n50911" type="main" key="vi^gi^lax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">watchful.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50911.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Subura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 15.—</sense><sense id="n50911.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 779</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vigilia: <entryFree id="n50912" type="main" key="vi^gi^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n50912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭ-lĭum</orth>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 232, 4</bibl>) [vigil]. </sense><sense id="n50912.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50912.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">wakefulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleeplessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lying awake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque vigilia praecesserit neque ventris resolutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum robora nocturnā vigiliā minuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui non sunt auditae Demosthenis vigiliae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl></cit>; id. Par. prooem. § 5.—</sense><sense id="n50912.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50912.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a keeping awake</hi> for the security of a place, esp. of a city or camp, <hi rend="ital">a watching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">excubiae, statio): noctu vigilias agere ad aedes sacras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestra tecta custodiis vigiliisque defendite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus stationibus vigiliisque fessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiles scutum in vigiliam ferre vetuit,</quote> <trans><tr>to take on guard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 33, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiliarum nocturnarum curam per urbem magistratibus mandavimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 16, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50912.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50912.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A watch</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the time of keeping watch by night</hi>, among the Romans a fourth part of the night: <cit><quote lang="la">nox in quattuor vigilias dividitur, quae singulae trium horarum spatio supputantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 140, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primā vigiliā capite arma frequentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 44, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 34, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 27, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum puer tuus ad me secundā fere vigiliā venisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tertiā vigiliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertiā vigiliā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 44, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quartā vigiliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50912.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The watch</hi>, i. e. those standing on guard, <hi rend="ital">watchmen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentinels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites disponit, non certis spatiis intermissis sed perpetuis vigiliis stationibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 25, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 45, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:100:4" default="NO" valid="yes">100, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 14, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50912.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A watching</hi> at religious festivals, <hi rend="ital">nightly vigils</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cereris vigiliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50912.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">watchfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilance</hi> (the figure taken from military sentinels; perh. only in the foll. passages; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas vigilantia is far more freq.): ut vacuum metu populum Romanum nostrā vigiliā et prospicientiā redderemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi in vigiliā quādam consulari ac senatoriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: cupio jam vigiliam meam, Brute, tibi tradere: sed ita, ut ne desim constantiae meae, <hi rend="ital">my post</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">my office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 24, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: cum summis vigiliis aliquid perficere, Just. Inst. prooem. § 1.</sense></entryFree>
vigiliarium: <entryFree id="n50913" type="main" key="vi^gi^li^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n50913.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A watchtower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 57:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 57, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50913.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small sepulchral monument in the shape of a watchtower</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4557</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigilium: <entryFree id="n50914" type="main" key="vi^gi^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. vigilia <sense id="n50914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vigilo: <entryFree id="n50915" type="main" key="vi^gi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n50915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [vigil]. </sense><sense id="n50915.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to watch</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep awake</hi> at night, <hi rend="ital">not to sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be wakeful</hi> (class.; syn. excubo). </sense><sense id="n50915.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad multam noctem vigilare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximā nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cb n="VIGO" /> ad ipsum Mane, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 17</bibl>.—With a homogeneous object: in lectitando ... vigilias vigilare, Gell. N. A. praef. § 19.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeo si vigilatur et hic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:68:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 68, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilat Troicus ignis,</quote> <trans><tr>burns continually</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:35" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina (of a light-house),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 31</bibl></cit>.—Prov. </sense><sense id="n50915.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Hic vigilans somniat, i. e. <hi rend="ital">builds castles in the air</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 68</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">num ille somniat Ea, quae vigilans voluit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50915.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Qui imperata effecta reddat, non qui vigilans dormiat, <hi rend="ital">who dreams with his eyes open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goes to sleep over a thing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 152</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et vigilans stertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1048" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1048</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilanti stertere naso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeo, si vigilatur et hic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:68:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 68, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50915.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50915.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be watchful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilantes curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 43, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi vigilantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 438</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50915.7" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to keep watch</hi> over any thing, <hi rend="ital">to be watchful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vigilant</hi>: vigilandum est semper: multae insidiae sunt bonis, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 24, 59</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 138 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">excubabo vigilaboque pro vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigila, Chrysippe, ne tuam causam deseras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vivas, vigila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis vigilare severis,</quote> <trans><tr>to engage in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">janitor ad dantes vigilet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 47: Mars, vigila, an invocation to Mars at the breaking out of a war, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50915.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to watch through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend in watching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to do</hi> or <hi rend="ital">make while watching</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">noctes vigilantur amarae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 169</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vigilata nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi jam breviorque dies et mollior aetas, Quae vigilanda viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen vigilatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:109" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilati labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magia occulta noctibus vigilata,</quote> <trans><tr>pursued by night</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 304, 28</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n50915.9" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B. 2.), <hi rend="ital">watchful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilantes et boni et fortes et misericordes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:48:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 48, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilans et acutus tribunus plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilans et industrius homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, B, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">sentiet in hac urbe esse consules vigilantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo paratior, vigilantior, compositior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 11, 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux (Hannibal),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>, ext. 1.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgĭlanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">watchfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilantly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:64:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 64, § 144</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilantius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 24, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilantissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 15, 32</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n50915.10" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭ-gĭlātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, for vigilanter, <hi rend="ital">watchfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilantly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viginti: <entryFree id="n50916" type="main" key="vi_ginti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīginti</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">XX</orth>.), <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. vicati; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)/kosi</foreign>; Boeot. <foreign lang="greek">vi/kati</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n50916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twenty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viginti jam usu'st filio argenti minis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si viginti quiessem dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 37, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos natus unum et viginti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:20:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 20, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 21, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">blattae impositae diebus viginti uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 141</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (Mithridati) duas et viginti linguas traditur notas fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor hinc rapimur viginti et milia raedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 86</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
vigintiangulus: <entryFree id="n50917" type="hapax" key="vi_ginti^angu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgintĭ-angŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n50917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having twenty angles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 5, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vigintivir: <entryFree id="n50918" type="main" key="vi_ginti^vir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgintĭvir</orth>, <itype>vĭri</itype>, v. vigintiviri.</entryFree>
vigintiviratus: <entryFree id="n50919" type="main" key="vi_ginti^vi^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgintĭvĭrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vigintiviri</etym>, <sense id="n50919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of the</hi> vigintiviri, <hi rend="ital">the vigintivirate;</hi> for the distribution of lands, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 16</bibl> Spald.—Of the inferior civil court, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl>.—Of a municipal court, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3970</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigintiviri: <entryFree id="n50920" type="main" key="vi_ginti^vi^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgintĭ-vĭri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a college</hi> or <hi rend="ital">board of twenty men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> vigintiviri. </sense><sense id="n50920.1" n="I" level="1"> Appointed by Cæsar during his consulship for distributing the Campanian lands, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:44:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 44, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 137" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 137</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 52, 53, § 176</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50920.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An inferior civil court</hi>, one half of whose members assisted the prætor, and the other half presided over the roads, the mint, and public executions, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Julian. 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2761</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3970</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50920.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A council of State</hi>, created A.D. 237, in opposition to Maximinus I., <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3042</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigor: <entryFree id="n50921" type="main" key="vi^gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vigeo</etym>, <sense id="n50921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">liveliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">activity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cæs. or Cic.): nec tarda senectus Debilitat vires animi mutatque vigorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 611</bibl></cit>: igneus est ollis <cb n="VILI" /> vigor, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 730</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventas et patrius vigor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum in illo (libro), di boni, vigoris est, quantum animi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 64:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 64, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae,</quote> <trans><tr>strong brilliancy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 28, § 101</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 109</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigores mentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:355" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 355</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vigoro: <entryFree id="n50922" type="main" key="vi^go_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭgōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vigor</etym>. <sense id="n50922.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to animate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invigorate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis vigoratus,</quote> <trans><tr>stout</tr>, <tr>lusty</tr>, <tr>vigorous</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 227</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50922.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain strength</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum animae vigorantis ex vite Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 26 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
vilesco: <entryFree id="n50923" type="main" key="vi_lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlesco</orth>, <itype>lŭi</itype>, 3 <sense id="n50923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [vilis], <hi rend="ital">to become worthless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis clarus homo vilescit in turbā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 66, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 22, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Joan. 24:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Joan. 24, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vilicatio: <entryFree id="n50924" type="main" key="vi_li^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. vilico, I.</etym>, <sense id="n50924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the care</hi> or <hi rend="ital">management of an estate in the country</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:27" default="NO">11, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proici de vilicatione suā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 121, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vilicatus: <entryFree id="n50925" type="main" key="vi_li^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stewardship</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Qu. Evang. 2:45" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Qu. Evang. 2, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vilico: <entryFree id="n50926" type="main" key="vi_li^co1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">villĭco</orth>; <sense id="n50926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> perh. not found), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.;</hi> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭ-cor</orth>, <itype>ātus sum, āri</itype>, 1., <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>vilicus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n50926.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50926.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To act as bailiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overseer; to superintend</hi> (prop. of a country estate). </sense><sense id="n50926.3" n="1" level="3"> Form vilico: <cit><quote lang="la">dispensare rem publicam, et in eā quodammodo vilicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50926.4" n="2" level="3"> Form vincor: non vilicari, sed dominari mea est sententia, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 186, 2</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 45 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">longe ab urbe vilicari, quo erus rarenter venit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 186, 1: hic vilicor ante urbem: nunc rus eo, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 186, 7</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 82 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n50926.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to live</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reside in the country.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50926.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: in Arpinos jam ... explodam hominem, ut vilicetur, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 186, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50926.7" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">adv. of place</hi>: ego nondum etiam hic vilicabar, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 186, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50926.8" n="3" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilicatus praediis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50926.9" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to manage</hi> an estate, etc., <hi rend="ital">as a bailiff</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">possessionem maximam illam vilicabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 211, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50927" type="main" key="vi_li^co2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">villĭco</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. vilico, II.</etym>, <sense id="n50927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one managing a farm; a bailiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overseer</hi>, etc. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">neget eum rationibus viliconum, et upilionum, et equisonum sollertissime subscripsisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 329</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vilicor: <entryFree id="n50928" type="main" key="vi_li^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. 1 vilico.</entryFree>
vilicus: <entryFree id="n50929" type="main" key="vi_li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭcus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">villĭcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>villa</etym>, <sense id="n50929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a countryhouse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">villa</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nomina lini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 56</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50929.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. homo). </sense><sense id="n50929.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An overseer of a farm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">estate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a steward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bailiff; absol.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 142</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 38, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 39, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 15</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilice silvarum et mihi me reddentis agelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilicus Orbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50929.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an overseer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superintendent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">director</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pegasus attonitae positus modo vilicus urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:77" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilici (sc. aquaeductum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 117" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum vilicum esse imperatorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 15</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 82, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AMPHITHEATRI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 5</bibl></cit>, n. 3.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">A PLVMBO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2859</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AB ALIMENTIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1033, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50929.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. mulier), <hi rend="ital">a female overseer; the wife of an overseer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 143, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12</bibl>, praef. 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:56:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 56, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:69" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vilifico: <entryFree id="n50930" type="main" key="vi_li^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vilis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n50930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">esteem of little value</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Isa. 15, 54, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vilipendo: <entryFree id="n50931" type="hapax" key="vi_li^pendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭpendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vilis-pendo</etym>, <sense id="n50931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hold in slight esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to depreciate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vilipend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vilis: <entryFree id="n50932" type="main" key="vi_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n50932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of small price</hi> or <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchased at a low rate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheap</hi> (opp. carus). </sense><sense id="n50932.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam hic vile nunc est nisi mores mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annona vilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec (puella) vero vilis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc verbum vile est viginti minis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eis praediis talenta argenti bina Statim capiebat ... Ac rebus vilioribus multo talenta bina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum quoniam vilius erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:84:section=195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 84, § 195</bibl></cit>: res vilissimae (opp. pretiosissimae),<pb n="1991" /> <cb n="VILL" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 91</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl. neutr.</hi> (sc. pretio), <hi rend="ital">at a small price</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at a low rate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheaply: Ep.</hi> Quanti eam emit? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Vili, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vili vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:66:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 66, 10</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod viliori praedium distraxerit ... et si non viliori vendidit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:24:11:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 24, 11, § 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res stipulatoris vilissimo distracta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n50932.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50932.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of trifling value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paltry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile</hi> (cf. indignus): <cit><quote lang="la">si honor noster vobis vilior fuisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 41, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam vile neque tam vulgare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Velia non est vilior quam Lupercal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi quorum tibi auctoritas est videlicet cara, vita vilissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem fortunas pericula vilia habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec adeo vilis tibi vita esset nostra, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et genus et virtus nisi cum re vilior alga est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Perfectos veteresque referri debet an inter Viles et novos?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilis Europe,</quote> <trans><tr>vile</tr>, <tr>abandoned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu poscis vilia rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si, dum me careas, est tibi vile mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 48</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">et vile virentes Hesperidum risit ramos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the ordinary manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 37</bibl></cit>: vile comparati, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:145" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 145</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">vile est, quod licet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50932.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: stat fucare colos nec Sidone vilior, Ancon. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:438" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 438</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50932.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Found in great quantities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phaselus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 227</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n50932.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">cheaply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire poteris intestinis vilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilissime constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilissime constiterit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50932.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">meanly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poorly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vilely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipsum colere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 344, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilissime natus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vilitas: <entryFree id="n50933" type="main" key="vi_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vilis</etym>, <sense id="n50933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lowness of price</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheapness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50933.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta repente vilitas annonae ex caritate rei frumentariae consecuta est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp.
