Pomp. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilitas in vendendis (fructibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98:section=227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alter annus in vilitate, alter in summā caritate fuerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 93</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">216: ad denarios senos vilitas rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 28, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offerre aliquid vilitati,</quote> <trans><tr>to offer for sale at a low price</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50933.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50933.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Trifling value</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">meanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baseness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vileness</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20</bibl></cit>, praef. § 1: si humiles producet, vilitatem; <cit><quote lang="la">potentes, gratiam oportebit incessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 344, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50933.4" n="B" level="2"> Subject., <hi rend="ital">low esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disregard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slighting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contempt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilitas sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 121, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viliter: <entryFree id="n50934" type="main" key="vi_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vilis <sense id="n50934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vilito: <entryFree id="n50935" type="hapax" key="vi_li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīlĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vilis, II.</etym>, <sense id="n50935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make cheap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of little esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to humble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degrade</hi>: quae (vitia) te vilitant, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 185, 31</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 88 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
villa: <entryFree id="n50936" type="main" key="villa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">villa</orth> (rustic, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vella</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 4</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>most prob. for vicula, from vicus</etym>, <sense id="n50936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">country-seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">villa.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50936.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 33</bibl>; Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 1, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50936.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">Villa Publica, in the Campus Martius, as the gathering-place, rendezvous for recruits, and of the people for the census, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 22, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 44, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:24" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 24</bibl>.—As the residence of foreign ambassadors, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 21, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 24, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50936.3" n="B" level="2"> = vicus, <hi rend="ital">a village</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
villaris: <entryFree id="n50937" type="main" key="villa_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">villāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>villa</etym>, <sense id="n50937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a country-seat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">villa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <trans><tr>reared at a country-seat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 41, 57, § 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
villaticus: <entryFree id="n50938" type="main" key="villa_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">villātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a country-house</hi> or <hi rend="ital">villa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">villaticum genus pastionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 17, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:13:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

villula: <entryFree id="n50944" type="main" key="villu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">villŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>villa</etym>, <sense id="n50944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little country-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small villa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 240, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
villum: <entryFree id="n50945" type="main" key="villum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">villum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>contr. from vinulum, from vinum</etym>, <sense id="n50945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sup of wine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc villi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
villus: <entryFree id="n50946" type="main" key="villus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">villus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. urā, sheep; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)=ros</foreign>, wool; cf. vellus</etym>, <sense id="n50946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shaggy hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tuft of hair;</hi> of beasts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 63, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 446</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 352</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:136:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 136, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> al.—Of cotton, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 23, 27, § 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsis mantelia villis,</quote> <trans><tr>the nap of cloth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 377</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 702</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vimen: <entryFree id="n50947" type="main" key="vi_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vieo</etym>, <sense id="n50947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pliant twig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a switch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">osier</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n50947.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:345 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 345 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50947.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50947.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slip;</hi> of willow, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50947.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The staff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wand of Mercury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:30" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50947.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Woven work</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a basket</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quernum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">breve Picenorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:88:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 88, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vimentum: <entryFree id="n50948" type="hapax" key="vi_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vimen</etym>, <sense id="n50948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an osier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withy</hi>, = vimen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viminalis: <entryFree id="n50949" type="main" key="vi_mi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīmĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to osiers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50949.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">salix,</quote> <trans><tr>bearing twigs for plaiting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 32, § 143</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50949.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj. propr.</hi>: Viminalis Collis, <hi rend="ital">one of the seven hills of Rome</hi> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44</bibl>), so named from a willow-copse which stood there; whence, also, the Jupiter there worshipped was called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vīmĭnĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=51" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 51</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 1:19" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=376" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 376</bibl> Müll.—The gate leading to it was called Viminalis Porta, Fest. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 1:19" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 1, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

G. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces virgarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salix,</quote> <trans><tr>serving for wicker-work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 69, § 177</bibl></cit> (al. viminalis).</sense></entryFree>

R. 2, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 197</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50958.5" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnācĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n50958.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A grape-stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:69" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50958.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A grape-skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 43, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50958.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A wine - cup</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligunt vinacea uvarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Osee, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

R. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. vinarius: <entryFree id="n50962" type="main" key="vi_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vinum</etym>, <sense id="n50962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wine-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50962.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 13, 14</bibl>. § <cit><quote lang="la">89: uter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 18, 73, § 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saccus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <trans><tr>relating to the duties on wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 9, 19</bibl></cit>: minister, <hi rend="ital">a cup - bearer</hi>, Hier. Chron. Euseb. ad ann. MDLXX. ab Abrah.—</sense><sense id="n50962.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50962.3" n="A" level="2"> <cb n="VINC" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wine-dealer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vintner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50962.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wine-bibber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 4</bibl>, §§ 2 and 25.—</sense><sense id="n50962.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wine-pot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wine-flask</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 46</bibl> (Ritschl; cf. Brix ad loc.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vincapervinca: <entryFree id="n50963" type="main" key="vinca pervinca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinca pervinca</orth> (also in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vincapervinca</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">periwinkle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:172" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 27, 99, § 172</bibl>; called also simply <orth extent="full" lang="la">pervinca</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinceus: <entryFree id="n50964" type="spur" key="vince^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vincĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, a false read. for juncea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 56</bibl>; v. junceus.</entryFree>
vinciam: <entryFree id="n50965" type="main" key="vinciam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinciam</orth> <itype>dicebant continentem</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=379" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 379</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n50965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (in the Cod. Basil. in Barth. Adv. 39, 5, is added, et est cognomen Jovis).</sense></entryFree>
vincibilis: <entryFree id="n50966" type="main" key="vinci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vincĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vinco</etym>. * <sense id="n50966.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that can be easily gained</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50966.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victorious</hi>: clangor, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of brazen implements in an eclipse of the moon</hi>, Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. Burm. 2, p. 329.</sense></entryFree>
vincio: <entryFree id="n50967" type="main" key="vinci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vincĭo</orth>, <itype>vinxi, vinctum</itype> (<sense id="n50967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part.</hi> vinciturus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 10</bibl>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wind about; to fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten; to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle</hi>, etc. (class., esp. in the trop. sense; syn.: ligo, necto, constringo). </sense><sense id="n50967.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum aput te vinctum adservato domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc abduce, vinci, quaere rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres meos in vincula conjecit. Cum igitur eos vinxerit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Dejot. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus est vincire civem Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites Romani vincti Apronio traditi sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">37: trinis catenis vinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post terga manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotas ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmum appositis vitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte suras purpureo cothurno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora novis floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.—In a Greek construction: <cit><quote lang="la">boves vincti cornua vittis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anule, formosae digitum vincture puellae,</quote> <trans><tr>about to encircle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50967.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50967.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To compress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">demissis umeris esse, vincto pectore, ut, gracilae sient,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>tightly laced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50967.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To compass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>, mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarem quidem aiunt acerrime dilectum habere, loca occupare, vinciri praesidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 18, 2</bibl></cit> B. and K. (al. vincire, i. e. loca).—</sense><sense id="n50967.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus vincta pruinā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 123</bibl></cit> (but the true reading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:96" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 96</bibl>, is juncta; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 4</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n50967.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vi Veneris vinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religione vinctus astrictusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:42:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 42, § 90</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si turpissime se illa pars animi geret ... si vinciatur et constringatur amicorum propinquorumque custodiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl></cit>.—Of sleep, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi vinctos somno velut pecudes trucidandos tradidero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 44, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut somno vincta jacebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in plaustra somno vinctos coniciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem multo Lyaeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit> (4, 4), 21: <cit><quote lang="la">inimica ora (magicis artibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:581" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectum certo foedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20, 21</bibl></cit> (4, 19, 11): <cit><quote lang="la">spadonis animum stupro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse tuam vinctam numine teste fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pacto matrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 45</bibl></cit>.—Of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">membra (orationis) sunt numeris vincienda,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>arranged rhythmically</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba vincta, oratio vincta (opp. soluta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:19" default="NO">9, 4, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinco: <entryFree id="n50968" type="main" key="vinco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinco</orth>, <itype>vīci, victum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. causat. of root <foreign lang="greek">ik-</foreign>; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)/kw</foreign>, to yield; but cf. per-vicax; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 106" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 106</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n50968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to conquer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get the better of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanquish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be victorious</hi>, etc. (syn.: supero, debello). </sense><sense id="n50968.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50968.2" n="A" level="2"> In war or battle: <cit><quote lang="la">jus esse belli, ut qui vicissent, iis, quos vicissent, quemadmodum vellent, imperarent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginienses navalibus pugnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliam bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non virtute neque in acie vicisse Romanos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id vi et virtute militum victum atque expugnatum oppidum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicimus vi feroces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: aio te, Aeacida, Romanos vincere posse, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 56, 116</bibl> (Ann. v. 186 Vahl.): sicut fortis equus, spatio qui saepe supremo Vicit Olympia, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 5, 14</bibl> (Ann. v. 442 ib.): aliquando<pb n="1992" /> <cb n="VINC" />  ut vincat, ludit assidue aleam, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. milia,</quote> <trans><tr>to win at play</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> ib. 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.3" n="B" level="2"> In a lawsuit, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be successful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincere judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 18, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tu horum nil refelles, vincam scilicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam suam,</quote> <trans><tr>to win</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 76</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum est: ventum est: vincimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.4" n="C" level="2"> In other relations, <hi rend="ital">to win</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be successful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 27, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:31:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 31, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicit iter durum pietas,</quote> <trans><tr>controlled</tr>, <tr>made easy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 688</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:23:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 23, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor omnia vicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 145</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">difficultates, Auct. B. G. 8, 21: virgam,</quote> <trans><tr>to win</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicit tamen in Senatu pars illa, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factione respectuque rerum privatarum ... Appius vicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in senatu vicisset sententia, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>: Othonem vincas volo, <hi rend="ital">to outbid</hi> (in an auction), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 33, 2</bibl>.—To defeat as a candidate for office: <cit><quote lang="la">competitorem in suffragiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.5" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate subjects. </sense><sense id="n50968.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail over</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">(naves) neu turbine venti Vincantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victa ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam gurgitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincunt aequora navitae,</quote> <trans><tr>prevail against</tr>, <tr>get the better of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victaque concessit prisca moneta novae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:222" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quernaque glans victa est utiliore cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:676" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 676</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora victa sopore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:422" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 422</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">blanda quies furtim victis obrepsit ocellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi casses (linei) vel ferri aciem vincunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campum turbā vincente,</quote> <trans><tr>overflowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:390" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 390</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To outlast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aesculus) Multa virum volvens durando saecula vincit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivendo mea fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To surmount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra (sagittae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 123</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">montes ascensu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.9" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To reduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi>, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">of cooking: nec viscera quisquam ... potest vincere flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleas undis calefactas et prope victas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> Med. 319</bibl></cit>.—Of smelting ores: <cit><quote lang="la">metallorum primitiae nullis fornacibus victae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 53</bibl></cit>.—Of melting snow: <cit><quote lang="la">nive, quae zephyro victa tepente fluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:220" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 220</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of digestion: pervigilio quidem praecipue vincuntur cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 118, § 283</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50968.11" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be superior; to convince</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentis vincit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturam studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincit ipsa rerum publicarum natura saepe rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:33:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 33, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 13</bibl>: si subitam et fortuitam orationem commentatio et cogitatio facile vincit; <cit><quote lang="la">hanc ipsam profecto assidua ac diligens scriptura superabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientis animus vincetur et expugnabitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est consentaneum, qui invictum se a labore praestiterit, vinci a voluptate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 20, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labascit, victu'st, uno verbo, quam cito!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eludet, ubi te victum senserit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius stultitiā victa ex urbe tu migres?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentulus saepe eadem audiendo victus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccavi, fateor, vincor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus patris precibus lacrimisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divūm pater victus tuis vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est qui vinci possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietas Victa furore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus amore pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia victa in lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus animi respexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphantes de lege victā et abrogatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo negatum, vincor, ut credam miser,</quote> <trans><tr>am constrained</tr>, <tr>compelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:27" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.12" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50968.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To overmatch</hi> in some quality, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>, = superare: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum globi terrae magnitudinem facile vincebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem vicit omnium, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectationem omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:5:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam (noctem) edepol etiam multo haec (nox) vicit longitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum immanitate vastissimas vincit beluas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:26:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 26, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamlibet mulierculam Vincere mollitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:24" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio qui posset vincere Regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere, quod Cassi opuscula vincat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 4</bibl></cit>, <cb n="VINC" /> 3; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qualia (praecepta) vincunt Pythagoran,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: vir nulli victus vel ponere castra vel junxisse ratem, etc., <hi rend="ital">excelled by none in pitching a camp</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:552" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 552</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:141" default="NO">6, 141</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To prove triumphantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi> or <hi rend="ital">demonstrate conclusively.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50968.15" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc? vincon' argumentis te non esse Sosiam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto ita esse, et praedico, vero vincam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vince deinde, bonum virum fuisse Oppianicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:44:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 44, 124</bibl></cit>: dicendo vincere non postulo, Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincet enim stultos ratio insanire nepotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 225</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.16" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vincet ratio hoc, tantundem ut peccet idemque Qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.17" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si doceo non ab Avito, vinco ab Oppianico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 23, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.18" n="3" level="3"> With respect to something disputed, <hi rend="ital">to prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain one's point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry the day.</hi> So only in the expressions, </sense><sense id="n50968.19" n="a" level="4"> Vicimus: <cit><quote lang="la">cui si esse in urbe tuto licebit, vicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpantur iniqui. Vicimus: assiduas non tulit illa preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: vicimus exclamat; <cit><quote lang="la">mecum mea vota feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 513</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicimus et meus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:356" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 356</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.20" n="b" level="4"> Vincite, viceris, vincerent, <hi rend="ital">have it your own way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as you like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry your point</hi>, an expression of reluctant assent: <cit><quote lang="la">vincite, si ita vultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 509</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincerent ac sibi haberent, dummodo scirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50968.21" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To treat worthily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set forth with dignity</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec sum animi dubius, verbis ea vincere magnum Quam sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 289</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vincere verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 733</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinctio: <entryFree id="n50969" type="main" key="vincti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vincio</etym>, <sense id="n50969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ligature</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 62</bibl> Müll.; <hi rend="ital">a shoetie</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.— Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 203</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinctor: <entryFree id="n50970" type="main" key="vinctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binder</hi> (postclass.); (with congregator) <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinctura: <entryFree id="n50971" type="main" key="vinctu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinctūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bandage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ligature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vincture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 68, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 62</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
vinctus: <entryFree id="n50972" type="main" key="vinctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of vincio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50973" type="main" key="vinctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vincio</etym>, <sense id="n50973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinctu, quod antiqui vocabant cestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinculo: <entryFree id="n50974" type="main" key="vincu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vincŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa animalia redimiculis gaudent, et phalerari sibi magis quam vinculari videntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 3, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:8:108" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 8, 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinculum: <entryFree id="n50975" type="main" key="vincu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vincŭlum</orth>, <itype>or</itype> (also in class. prose), contr., <orth extent="full" lang="la">vinclum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that with which any thing is bound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie</hi> (cf.: catena, manica, compes). </sense><sense id="n50975.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora constricta vinculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodos et vincula rupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic fessas non vincula naves Ulla tenent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chio solvite vincla cado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicarum vincla relaxat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:321" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis Charta sit a vinclis non labefacta suis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the seal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae sua vincula dempsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:7:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolae laxare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennarum vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Tyrrhena pedum circumdat vincula plantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 458</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of sandals,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:66" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:410" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 410</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 324</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 823</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50975.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp. in the <number>plur.</number>, of the <hi rend="ital">fetters</hi> of prisoners, and hence sometimes to be rendered <hi rend="ital">prison;</hi> and vincula publica, <hi rend="ital">the state-prison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitto vincla, mitto carcerem, mitto verbera, mitto secures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:24:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 24, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aeternis tenebris vinculisque mandare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de convivio in vincla atque in tenebras abripi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 24</bibl></cit>: in vincula conjectus, Caes. B. G, 3, 9; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 27: in vincula duci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:49:2" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 49, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:4" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 56, 4</bibl>; 3, 57, 5; 5, 9, 4; 9, 34, 24; 38, 56, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:7:2 al" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 7, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vinculis et catenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ex vinculis causam dicere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to plead in chains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Paus. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cim. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 26, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50975.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">band</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex corporum vinculis tamquam e carcere evolaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:14:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculum ad astringendam fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 31, 111</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">victum ingens vinculum fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula revellit non modo judiciorum, sed etiam utilitatis vitaeque communis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculum ingens immodicae cupiditatis injectum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 13, 14</bibl></cit>: quae (beneficium et gratia) <cb n="VIND" /> sunt vincula concordiae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculis et propinquitatis et affinitatis conjunctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincla summae conjunctionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedit maximum vinculum, quod ita rem publicam geris, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vinclum, quaeso, deest nostrae conjunctioni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cui me vinclo vellem jugali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 549</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusare laborem et mercenaria vincla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vindelici: <entryFree id="n50976" type="main" key="Vinde^li^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vindĕlĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose chief town was Augusta Vindelicorum</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Augsburg</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl>; Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 243</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n50976.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vindĕlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Vindelici</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vindelician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:85:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 85, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 415</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50976.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vindĕ-lĭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Vindelici</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vindelicia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 488</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vindemia: <entryFree id="n50977" type="main" key="vinde_mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vinum-demo</etym>, <sense id="n50977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grape - gathering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vintage.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50977.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 37</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 54, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:70" default="NO">11, 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 315</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50977.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50977.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Grapes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vintage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eadem arboribus pendet vindemia nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 522</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spumat plenis vindemia labris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursi fruge, fronde, vindemiā, pomis vivunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 73, 93, § 199</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50977.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the time of grape-gathering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the vintage season</hi>, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad M. Caes. 5:23" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad M. Caes. 5, 23</bibl> and 47.—</sense><sense id="n50977.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The gathering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">harvest</hi> of similar things: <cit><quote lang="la">olearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 14, 14, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vindemialis: <entryFree id="n50978" type="main" key="vinde_mi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vindemia</etym>, <sense id="n50978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the vintage</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ESCAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4419</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 9:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vindemiator: <entryFree id="n50979" type="main" key="vinde_mi^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭātor</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vindemio</etym>, <sense id="n50979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grape-gatherer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vintager.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50979.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=94" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 94</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 30</bibl> (scanned vin-dem-ja-tor); form vindemitor, Sen. Apocol. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n50979.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a star in the constellation Virgo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 24</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form Vindemitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:407" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 407</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 309</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vindemiatorius: <entryFree id="n50980" type="main" key="vinde_mi^a_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vindemiator</etym>, <sense id="n50980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the vintage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vindemio: <entryFree id="n50981" type="main" key="vinde_mi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>vindemia</etym>, <sense id="n50981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gather grapes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gather the vintage</hi> (post-Aug.); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam et Calend. Jan. vindemiantes vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 319</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:310" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10, 37, § 310</bibl>. —With a homogeneous object: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:33:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vindemiola: <entryFree id="n50982" type="hapax" key="vinde_mi^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little vintage</hi>, transf., of income, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vindemitor: <entryFree id="n50983" type="main" key="vinde_mi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindēmĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, v. vindemiator.</entryFree>
vindex: <entryFree id="n50984" type="main" key="vindex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>vindico</etym>. <sense id="n50984.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who lays legal claim</hi> to a thing, <hi rend="ital">a claimant;</hi> hence, also, <hi rend="ital">a maintainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliverer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liberator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vindicator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindex ab eo, quod vindicat, quominus is, qui prensus est, ab aliquo teneatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=376" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 376</bibl></cit> Müll.: ASSIDVO. VINDEX. ASSIDVVS. ESTO. PROLETARIO. CIVI. QVOI. QVIS. VOLET. VINDEX. ESTO, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeat sane populus tabellam quasi vindicem libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeris alieni,</quote> <trans><tr>a defender</tr>, <tr>protector of debtors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatis imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 28, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum ac libertatis (M. Brutus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae,</quote> <trans><tr>a protector from wrong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 46, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculi,</quote> <trans><tr>in peril</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae (Hercules),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum Vindice decepto Graias misistis in urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:214" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec deus intersit, nisi dignus vindice nodus Inciderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honori posterorum tuorum ut vindex fieres,</quote> <trans><tr>a preserver</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">audita vox una (provoco) vindex libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicibus pacatus viribus orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50984.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An avenger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revenger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custos ac vindex cupiditatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindex ultorque parentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 237</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Furiae deae ... vindices facinorum et scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 46</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Tisiphone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:80" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 80</bibl></cit>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">vindice flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 192</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vindicatio: <entryFree id="n50985" type="main" key="vindi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n50985.0" n="I" level="1"> In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">a laying claim</hi> to a thing, <hi rend="ital">a civil action</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lawsuit</hi> for a thing, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 24</bibl>; <pb n="1993" /> <cb n="VIND" /> 4, 16 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 7, 24</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">De rei vindicatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, tit. 1: intestatorum civium concessam vindicationem bonorum adfirmare, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50985.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A taking into protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vindication: an avenging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi> of an offence: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicatio est, per quam vim et contumeliam defendendo aut ulciscendo propulsamus a nobis et a nostris, qui nobis esse cari debent: et per quam peccata punimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 53, 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vindicator: <entryFree id="n50986" type="main" key="vindi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vindico</etym>, <sense id="n50986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an avenger</hi> (eccl. Lat.), S. S. Psa. 8, 3 ap. Aug.</sense></entryFree>
vindicia: <entryFree id="n50987" type="main" key="vindi^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindĭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. vindiciae <sense id="n50987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vindiciae: <entryFree id="n50988" type="main" key="vindi^ci^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindĭcĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (in <number>sing.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vindĭ-cĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=376" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 376</bibl> Müll.; cf. Serv. Sulp. ib. and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10, 8</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vindico</etym>, <sense id="n50988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laying claim to</hi> a thing before the praetor by both contending parties (hence in <number>plur.</number>); <hi rend="ital">a legal claim</hi> made in respect to a thing, whether as one's own property, or for its restoration to a free condition: <cit><quote lang="la">vindiciae appellantur res eae, de quibus controversia ... Ser. Sulpicius (vocabulo) jam singulariter formato vindiciam ait esse, quā de re controversia est, ab eo quod vindicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=376" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 376</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicia, id est correptio manūs in re atque in loco praesenti apud Praetorem ex duodecim tabulis fiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: SI VINDICIAM FALSAM TVLIT REI SIVE LITIS, i. e. <hi rend="ital">has falsely obtained possession of the thing claimed</hi>, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=376" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 376</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">aut pro praede litis vindiciarum cum satis accepisset, sponsionem faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:45:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 45, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injustis vindiciis ac sacramentis alienos fundos petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicias ab libertate in servitutem dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to sentence a free person to slavery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57:5" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 57, 5</bibl>; cf. Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 44, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: quo (ore) vindiciae nuper ab libertate dictae erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetores secundum populum vindicias dicunt, Cato ap. Fest. l. l.: decrēsse vindicias secundum servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Claudio clienti negotium dedit, ut virginem in servitutem assereret neque cederet secundum libertatem postulantibus vindicias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to those who demanded her liberation</tr>, <tr>her liberty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 44, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, of the praetor: lege ab ipso lata vindicias det secundum libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 44, 12</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum decemviri Romae sine provocatione fuerunt, tertio illo anno, cum vindicias amisisset ipsa libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:32:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 32, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vindicius: <entryFree id="n50989" type="main" key="Vindi^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vindĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of the slave who discovered the conspiracy to restore the Tarquins</hi>, Liv 2, 5, 10 Weissenb. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
vindico: <entryFree id="n50990" type="main" key="vindi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindĭco</orth> (on account of a supposed derivation from venum - dico, also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">vendĭco</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (collat. form, acc. to the 3d conj., VINDICIT, XII.
