Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vim - dico, prop. to assert authority, viz. in a case where legal possession of a thing claimed is refused; hence, transf.</etym>, <sense id="n50990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay legal claim to</hi> a thing, whether as one's own property or for its restoration to a free condition. </sense><sense id="n50990.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: IN. IVS. DVCITO. NI IVDICATVM FACIT AVT QVIS ENDO EOM IVRE VINDICIT, i. e. eum in jure vindicat, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:45" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 45</bibl>; cf., on the form of laying claim to disputed personal property, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicare sponsam in libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 45, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 48, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 46, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita vindicatur Virginia spondentibus propinquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 46, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50990.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. (freq. and class.; cf. assero). </sense><sense id="n50990.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lay claim to as one's own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a claim upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">claim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrogate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia non Quiritium sed sapientium jure pro suis vindicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videor id meo jure quodam modo vindicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homerum ... Chii suum vindicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortūs nostri partem patria vindicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximam partem quasi suo jure Fortuna sibi vindicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterarum rerum quae sunt in oratore, partem aliquam sibi quisque vindicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod neque summi imperatores ... sibi umquam vindicare sunt ausi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">14: partem oneris tui mihi vindico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatem sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:42:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 42, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partis sibi aequas potentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:30:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Helv. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 1, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3" default="NO">5, 3</bibl>, ext. 2; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:8:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl>: iniquissima haec bellorum condicio est; <cb n="VIND" /> prospera omnes sibi vindicant, adversa uni imputantur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae majore parte ad se vindicatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus belli ad se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 43, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta tamen universae Galliae consensio fuit libertatis vindicandae, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>should be maintained</tr>, <tr>vindicated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trasimenum pro Tarsimeno multi auctores ... vindicaverunt,</quote> <trans><tr>have adopted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicet antiquam faciem, vultusque ferinos Detrahat,</quote> <trans><tr>reassume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 523</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicat hoc Pharius dextrā gestare satelles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 675</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50990.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To place</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">in a free condition.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50990.5" n="1" level="3"> In libertatem vindicare, <hi rend="ital">to set free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emancipate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libertatem rem populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex dominatu Ti. Gracchi in libertatem rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:212" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 58, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam afflictam et oppressam in veterem dignitatem ac libertatem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to restore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliam in libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se et populum Romanum in libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50990.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To deliver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liberate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ab eo vindico et libero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos a verberibus, ab unco, a crucis terrore neque res gestae neque acta aetas neque vestri honores vindicabunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia sola nos a libidinum impetu et formidinum terrore vindicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:14:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin ab hoc ignotissimo Phryge nobilissimum civem vindicetis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a miseriis morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:329" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 96, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a molestiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum suam a solitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem summorum oratorum ab oblivione hominum atque a silentio,</quote> <trans><tr>rescue</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ab hac necessitate egregie vos fortuna vindicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora a putrescendo (sal),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebur a carie (vetus oleum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum a canitie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 46, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se non modo ex suspitione tanti sceleris, verum etiam ex omni hominum sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetienda illa fuerunt, ut se aliquando ad suos vindicaret,</quote> <trans><tr>might restore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam dura ad saxa revinctam Vindicat Alcides,</quote> <trans><tr>sets free</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem absolutus vindicatusque est (reus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50990.7" n="C" level="2"> With respect to some wrong perpetrated (cf. ulciscor), <hi rend="ital">to avenge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revenge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punish; to take vengeance</hi> on any one; <hi rend="ital">make compensation for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae vindicaris in altero, sibi ipsi vehementer fugienda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maleficium in aliis vindicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus in nullo etiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:84:section=194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 84, § 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolum malum et legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>. acerrime maleficia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consensionem improborum supplicio omni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam rem quam vehementer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ti. Gracchi conatus perditos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necem Crassi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:468" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensas ense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuita non civium tantummodo sed urbium damna principis munificentia vindicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:126:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 126, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateor non modo in socios, sed etiam in cives militesque nostros persaepe esse severe ac vehementer vindicatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:50:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 50, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicandum in eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicatum in eos, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 9, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in quos (Venetos) eo gravius Caesar vindicandum statuit, quo diligentius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50990.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (after the analogy of ulcisci): vindicare se ab (de) aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to revenge one's self upon</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:5:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se de fortunā praefationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantā saevitiā opus erat, ut Sulla de Mario vindicaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:19" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vindicta: <entryFree id="n50991" type="main" key="vindicta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vindicta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vindico</etym>, <sense id="n50991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the staff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rod with which a slave was touched in the ceremony of manumission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a liberating-rod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manumission - staff.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50991.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si neque censu neque vindictā nec testamento liber factus est, non est liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te quoque servari, modo quam vindicta redemit, Quis ferat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 615</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:88" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 16, 4</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 17 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 4, 12, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50991.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n50991.3" n="A" level="2"> (Cf. vindico, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">A means of asserting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vindication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence;</hi> esp. with libertatis: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas in ipsā vindictā libertatis peritura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 49, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindictam aliquam libertatis suae quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 37, 10</bibl></cit>: utrique <cb n="VINU" /> vindicta libertatis morte stetit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:64:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 64, 3</bibl>. —In other connections: <cit><quote lang="la">petatur a virtute invisae hujus vitae vindicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors, inquit, una vindicta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis severae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 6, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50991.4" n="B" level="2"> (Cf. vindico, II. C.) <hi rend="ital">Vengeance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revenge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi> (syn. ultio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:22" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 29, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:180" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:191" default="NO">13, 191</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinea: <entryFree id="n50992" type="main" key="vi_ne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. vineus, II.</entryFree>
vinealis: <entryFree id="n50993" type="main" key="vi_ne^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĕālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vinea</etym>, <sense id="n50993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to vines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>land suitable for planting vines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinearius: <entryFree id="n50994" type="main" key="vi_ne^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to vines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <trans><tr>vine-hills</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:36" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <trans><tr>vineyards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:198" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vineaticus: <entryFree id="n50995" type="main" key="vi_ne^a_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĕātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to vines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 33, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <trans><tr>vintage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falculae,</quote> <trans><tr>vine-dressers' knives</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinetum: <entryFree id="n50996" type="main" key="vi_ne_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vinum</etym>, <sense id="n50996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plantation of vines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vineyard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 37</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:167" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 167</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 36, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 319</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:2" default="NO">12, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 7</bibl>.—Prov.: vineta sua caedere, i. q. <hi rend="ital">to be severe against one's self</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 220</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vineus: <entryFree id="n50997" type="main" key="vi_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to wine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50997.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (so very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">latex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n50997.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n50997.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A plantation of vines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vineyard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 17, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 390</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 1, 29 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n50997.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A vine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:10:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:5" default="NO">4, 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50997.5" n="C" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a kind of penthouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">mantlet</hi>, built like an arbor, for sheltering besiegers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 21</bibl>; 7, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:110 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 110 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 15</bibl>: sub vineam jacere dicuntur milites, cum astantibus centurionibus jacere coguntur sudes, Fest. s. v. sub, p. 311 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
vinibua: <entryFree id="n50998" type="hapax" key="vi_ni^bu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĭbŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vinum - and bu-; cf.: imbuo, bibo</etym>, <sense id="n50998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female wine-bibber</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 81, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinifer: <entryFree id="n50999" type="hapax" key="vi_ni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vinumfero</etym>, <sense id="n50999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine-producing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinitor: <entryFree id="n51000" type="main" key="vi_ni^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vinum</etym>, <sense id="n51000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vine-dresser</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinitorius: <entryFree id="n51001" type="hapax" key="vi_ni^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vinitor</etym>, <sense id="n51001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a vine-dresser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falx,</quote> <trans><tr>a vinedresser's knife</tr>, <tr>pruning-hook</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinnulus: <entryFree id="n51002" type="hapax" key="vinnu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vinnŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. for venerula from Venus</etym>, <sense id="n51002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">delightful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio vinnula, venustula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinolentia: <entryFree id="n51003" type="main" key="vi_no^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnŏlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vinolentus</etym>, <sense id="n51003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">winebibbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intoxication from wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 39, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:20:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 20, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vinolentus: <entryFree id="n51004" type="main" key="vi_no^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnŏlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vinum</etym>, <sense id="n51004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drunk with wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intoxicated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sobrius in violentiam vinolentorum incidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <trans><tr>strongly mixed with wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinositas: <entryFree id="n51005" type="main" key="vi_no_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vinosus</etym>, <sense id="n51005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the flavor of wine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
vinosus: <entryFree id="n51006" type="main" key="vi_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vinum</etym>, <sense id="n51006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drunk with wine; fond of wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winebibbing</hi> (syn.: temulentus, ebrius): non modo vinosus, sed virosus quoque, Scip. Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudibus arguitur vini vinosus Homerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modice vinosi,</quote> <trans><tr>drunken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 330</bibl>: moris sucus in carne vinosus, <hi rend="ital">having the taste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flavor of wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 27, § 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor seminis nardi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 13, 27, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor seminis ambrosiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus Punicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 19, 34, § 113</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:765" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 765</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vinum: <entryFree id="n51007" type="main" key="vi_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (in vulg. lang. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 41, 12</bibl>; cf. Schol. Bern. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 98</bibl>) [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">oi)=nos</foreign>], <sense id="n51007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51007.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 23, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 265</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini minister,</quote> <trans><tr>butler</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: vina, <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 274</bibl>; also, esp., <hi rend="ital">sorts of wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wines</hi>, Cato, <pb n="1994" /> <cb n="VIOL" /> R. R. 147 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 6, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina tot consulum regionumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51007.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51007.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Grapes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum pendens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum priusque coctum est pendet putidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=94" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 94</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n51007.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The vine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus vino optimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51007.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wine made of fruits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit-wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:103" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 16, 19, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:52" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 26, § 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mart. 10, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vio: <entryFree id="n51008" type="main" key="vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>via</etym>, <sense id="n51008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">travel</hi> (postAug. and very rare; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vio pro eo infelicius fictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 33</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">legati intenti ad viandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter viandi multifidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 772</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vians maritus,</quote> <trans><tr>travelling about</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 240</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>, p. 184; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 24, 4</bibl>.—<pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭantes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">travellers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viantibus opportunae viae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viocurus: <entryFree id="n51009" type="main" key="vi^o^cu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏcūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>via-curo</etym>, <sense id="n51009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overseer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">constructor of roads</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5</bibl>, §§ 7 and 158 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
viola: <entryFree id="n51010" type="main" key="vi^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)/on</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n51010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the violet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the stock-gillyflower.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51010.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 14, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:64" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 11, 38, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 39</bibl>. —Collect.: <cit><quote lang="la">an tu me in violā putabas aut in rosā dicere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:26:73 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 26, 73 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n51010.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A violet color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 32, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:121" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 9, 40, § 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
violabilis: <entryFree id="n51011" type="main" key="vi^o^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>violo</etym>, <sense id="n51011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be injured</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cor levibus telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non violabile numen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba nullis armis, senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:258" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 258</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violaceus: <entryFree id="n51012" type="main" key="vi^o^la_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>viola, II.</etym>, <sense id="n51012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">violet-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violet</hi>: purpura, Nep. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 39, 63, § 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 18, 21, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 61, § 170</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violacium: <entryFree id="n51013" type="main" key="vi^o^la_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlācĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>viola</etym>, <sense id="n51013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">violet-wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
violaris: <entryFree id="n51014" type="gloss" key="vi^o^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to violets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violet-</hi>: DIE, <hi rend="ital">the day on which graves were garlanded with violets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roses</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 724, 443</bibl>; cf. rosales.</sense></entryFree>
violarium: <entryFree id="n51015" type="main" key="vi^o^la_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bank of violets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:35:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:437" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 437</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:259" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 259</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
violarius: <entryFree id="n51016" type="main" key="vi^o^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>viola, II.</etym>, <sense id="n51016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dyer of violet color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 36</bibl>; Inscr. Don. cl. 8, n. 78.</sense></entryFree>
violatio: <entryFree id="n51017" type="main" key="vi^o^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>violo</etym>, <sense id="n51017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an injury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profanation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violation</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violator: <entryFree id="n51018" type="main" key="vi^o^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an injurer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profaner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violator</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foederis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictatoris (C. Caesaris),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>murderer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—In apposit., <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natrix violator aquae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>polluting</tr>, <tr>poisoning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 720</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violatrix: <entryFree id="n51019" type="main" key="vi^o^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>violator</etym>, <sense id="n51019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who profanes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Mor. Manich. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violatus: <entryFree id="n51020" type="main" key="vi^o^la_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of violo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51021" type="main" key="vi^o^la_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>viola</etym>, <sense id="n51021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flavored with violets</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violens: <entryFree id="n51022" type="main" key="vi^o^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vis</etym>, <sense id="n51022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose, whereas violentus is class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Aufidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victor equus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 37</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so (with ferus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:171" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 171</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violenter: <entryFree id="n51023" type="main" key="vi^o^lenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>violens</etym>, <sense id="n51023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impetuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>: solennia ludorum violenter dirimere. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio exercita aspere violenterque,</quote> <trans><tr>furiously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 40, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid tolerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidimus flavum Tiberim retortis Litore Etrusco violenter undis Ire dejectum monumenta regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invadunt appropinquantem (canes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proconsulatum violenter gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad supplicium poscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">increpare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 7, 16</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 25, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
violentia: <entryFree id="n51024" type="main" key="vi^o^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>violentus</etym>, <sense id="n51024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuosity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferocity</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illi hanc vim appellant, quae est potius violentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi hominis furorem, novi effrenatam violentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinolentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 118</bibl></cit>: minis ejus ac violentiā territus, Suet. Ner. <cb n="VIPE" /> 34: <cit><quote lang="la">gentium,</quote> <trans><tr>ferocity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acris leonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 741</bibl></cit>.—Of things, concr. and abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">vehemens vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe fortunae violentiam toleravisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidua hiemis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radii solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 16, 13, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultūs,</quote> <trans><tr>fierceness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dolo nihil profecerit, vi et violentiā deicere eos conatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 29, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violentus: <entryFree id="n51025" type="main" key="vi^o^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vis</etym>, <sense id="n51025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">forcible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boisterous</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi id rescivit factum frater violentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo vehemens et violentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis sis, ut es, violentus et furens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus saevissimus et violentissimus in suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 46, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Piso ingenio violentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciē violenta Corinna est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentus in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:964" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 964</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis leonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucania bellum Incuteret violenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 217</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:368" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 368</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1231" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1231</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentior Eurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentior amnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentissimae tempestates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:49:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 49, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentissimus caeli status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae res violentissimae, ferrum et ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors infantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 1172" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 1172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis violentum est, nulla esse dicere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>it is unreasonable</tr>, <tr>it is going too far</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 72</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> does not occur.</sense></entryFree>
violeus: <entryFree id="n51026" type="main" key="vi^o^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>viola</etym>, <sense id="n51026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">violet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a violet color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
violo: <entryFree id="n51027" type="main" key="vi^o^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vis</etym>, <sense id="n51027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to treat with violence</hi> (corporeally, and, more freq., mentally), <hi rend="ital">to injure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outrage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violate</hi> (cf.: laedo, polluo, contamino). </sense><sense id="n51027.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> with persons as objects: <cit><quote lang="la">hospites violare fas non putant,</quote> <trans><tr>to injure</tr>, <tr>do violence to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam prodere, parentes violare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 32</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: virginem, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=80" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 80</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:51" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 51</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum vulnere corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 591</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Getico peream violatus ab arcu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:5:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 5, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51027.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51027.3" n="A" level="2"> With places as objects, <hi rend="ital">to invade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profane</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines eorum se violaturum negavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca religiosa et lucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iliacos agros ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cereale nemus securi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 741</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva vetus nullāque diu violata securi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:649" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 649</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51027.4" n="B" level="2"> With the senses as objects, <hi rend="ital">to outrage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos nostros (tua epistola),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aures meas obsceno sermone,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51027.5" n="C" level="2"> With abstract objects, <hi rend="ital">to violate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outrage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injure</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginitatem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inducias per scelus,</quote> <trans><tr>to break</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 44, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimationem absentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 23, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis nostri famam tuis probris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:32:section=82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 32, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem alicujus in aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae sunt, quae aut pulsatione corpus aut convicio aures aut aliquā turpitudine vitam cujuspiam violant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 25, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51027.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (rare and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Indum sanguineo ostro ebur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to dye of a blood-red</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 67</bibl></cit> (an imitation of the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">e)le/fanta foi/niki mih/nh</foreign>, Il. 4, 141).</sense></entryFree>
vipera: <entryFree id="n51028" type="main" key="vi_pe^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīpĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from vivipera, from vivus-pario, that brings forth living young</etym>, <sense id="n51028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a viper.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51028.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Coluber berus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 62, 82, § 169</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51028.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51028.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serpent</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 7, 53; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 417</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 421</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:376 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 376 al.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">in sinu viperam habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:24:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 24, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viperam nutricare sub alā,</quote> <trans><tr>to nourish a viper in one's bosom</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 77</bibl></cit>: vipera est in vepreculā, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 231, 13</bibl>; v. veprecula.—</sense><sense id="n51028.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Viper! serpent!</hi> as a term of reproach for a dangerous person: <cit><quote lang="la">saevissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:641" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 641</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem, vipera, sibilare desiste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:37" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viperalis: <entryFree id="n51029" type="main" key="vi_pe^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīpĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vipera</etym>, <sense id="n51029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for vipers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans><tr>good against the bite of a viper</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 89</bibl></cit>. <cb n="VIR" /></sense></entryFree>
vipereus: <entryFree id="n51030" type="main" key="vi_pe^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīpĕrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vipera</etym>, <sense id="n51030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a viper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serpent</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">snake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:203" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:769" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 769</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 635</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:7:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the serpent-haired head of Medusa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 615</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sorores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Furies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:662" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>winged serpents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:391" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 391</bibl></cit>: genus fratrum, <hi rend="ital">sprung from the dragon's teeth</hi> of Cadmus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 597" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 597</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans><tr>with serpent fingers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>poisonous breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 351</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viperinus: <entryFree id="n51031" type="main" key="vi_pe^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīpĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n51031.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of a viper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serpent</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">snake.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51031.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 115, § 279</bibl></cit>: morsus, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodo coërces viperino Bistonidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51031.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīpĕrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (herba), <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> serpentaria, <hi rend="ital">dragonwort</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 5</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51031.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Serpent - formed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serpent-like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda (chamaeleonis) implicans se viperinis orbibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 33, 51, § 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vipio: <entryFree id="n51032" type="main" key="vipi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vipĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of small crane</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 49, 69, § 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vipsanius: <entryFree id="n51033" type="main" key="Vipsa_nius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vipsānius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; <cit><quote lang="la">e. g. M. Vipsanius Agrippa,</quote> <trans><tr>the son-inlaw of Augustus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl></cit> and 63; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vipsānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Vipsanius Agrippa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vipsanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae, in the portico of Agrippa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:18:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:109:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 109, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vir: <entryFree id="n51034" type="main" key="vi^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭr</orth>, <itype>vĭri</itype> (<sense id="n51034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> virūm, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 251</bibl> P., or Ann. v. 280 Vahl.; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=257" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 257</bibl> Müll., or Ann. v. 394 Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:553 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 553 al.</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. vira, hero; the root is in O. H. Germ. weralt; Angl.Sax. veruld; Engl. world, i. e. age or generation of men</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a male person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a man</hi> (opp. femina; cf. mas). </sense><sense id="n51034.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">virum me natam vellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deque viro factus (mirabile') femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiguus fuerit modo vir, modo femina Sithon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:280" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier conjuncta viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1012" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1012</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir mulierque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientissimorum nostrae civitatis virorum disputatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir prudens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clari viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir clarus et honoratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestantior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus et sapiens et legibus parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 15, 64</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. bonus: optimi (opp. homines improbi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 8, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 498</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51034.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A man</hi> as related to a woman, <hi rend="ital">a husband</hi>, maritus (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">is (Juppiter) amare occepit Alcumenam clam virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">134</bibl>; 1, 3, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (vultum) dicitur Xanthippe praedicare solita in viro suo fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:31:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 5, 31, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 13, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:127 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 127 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:28" default="NO">5, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:28" default="NO">7, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:22 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 22 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals, <hi rend="ital">the male</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mate</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 660</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 11</bibl>;
