<bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A man</hi> (opp. a boy): <cit><quote lang="la">pueri hoc possunt, viri non potuerunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex toto non sic pueri ut viri curari debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueroque viroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eos (pueros) prius in urbem redire, quam viri facti essent, statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum essem parvulus ... quando factus sum vir, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 13, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.5" n="C" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">a man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a man of courage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principle</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who deserves the name of a man</hi>: Marius rusticanus vir, sed plane vir, cum secaretur, vetuit se alligari ... Ita et tulit dolorem, ut vir; <cit><quote lang="la">et, ut homo, majorem ferre sine causā necessariā noluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum is jam se corroboravisset ac vir inter viros esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te oro, te colligas virumque praebeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: si vir esse volet, praeclara <foreign lang="greek">sunodi/a</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum viro et gubernatore opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 41, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 46, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 38, 6 et saep.: si quid in Flacco viri est, Non feret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:12" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.6" n="D" level="2"> In milit. lang. </sense><sense id="n51034.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen., like our <hi rend="ital">man</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">soldier</hi> (syn. miles): <cit><quote lang="la">dispertiti viri, dispertiti ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">boat Caelum fremitu virum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: vir <pb n="1995" /> <cb n="VIRE" /> unus cum viro congrediendo, T. Manlius, M. Valerius, quantum Gallicam rabiem vinceret Romana virtus, docuerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic., as opposed to the cavalry, <hi rend="ital">a foot-soldier</hi> (syn. pedes): <cit><quote lang="la">equites virique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā voce trahens equitemque virosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:559" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passim turmaeque virique, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 123</bibl></cit>.—Hence, prov.: equis viris, or viris equisque, <hi rend="ital">with horse and foot</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with might and main;</hi> v. equus.—</sense><sense id="n51034.9" n="E" level="2"> With emphasis in place of a pronoun of reference, is, ille, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">fletusque et conploratio fregere tandem virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae tantae viri virtutes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 9, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.10" n="F" level="1"> Distributively, <hi rend="ital">each man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir virum legit, of choosing a senator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir cum viro congrediaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: legitque virum vir, <hi rend="ital">singled out</hi> (in battle), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 632</bibl> (an imitation of Hom. Il. 4, 472: <foreign lang="greek">a)nh\r d) a)/ndr) e)dnopa/lizen</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum vir virum legisset,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a companion in battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 39, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, in a sarcastic transfer-: ille (Clodius), qui semper secum scorta, semper exoletos, semper lupas ducebat, tum neminem, nisi ut virum a viro lectum esse diceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 21, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.11" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Human beings</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> homines, opp. pecudes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 286</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 553</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51034.12" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Manhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virility</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut relicta sensit sibi membra sine viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro mollita juventus Atque exsecta virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 134</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vira: <entryFree id="n51035" type="main" key="vi^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vir</etym>, <sense id="n51035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nunc femina, antiquitus vira vocabatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 2, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virago: <entryFree id="n51036" type="main" key="vi^ra_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>virgo</etym>, <sense id="n51036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a man-like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heroic maiden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a female warrior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heroine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virago</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">virago aliqua ancilla,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>vigorous</tr>, <tr>stout</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: vos etenim juvenes animum geritis muliebrem, Illa virago viri, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl>: virago Paluda, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Minerva</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 37</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 510 Vahl.); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 765</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:23" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:414" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 11, 414</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippcl. 54" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippcl. 54</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">Juturna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 468</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">an Amazon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">Eve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viratus: <entryFree id="n51037" type="main" key="vi^ra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vir</etym>, <sense id="n51037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a manly spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manly</hi>: vir, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 187, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 28, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51038" type="hapax" key="vi^ra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">manly conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manliness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virbius: <entryFree id="n51039" type="main" key="Virbi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virbĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n51039.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of Hippolytus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 544</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:756" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 756</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51039.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The surname of a son of Hippolytus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 762</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virdicatus: <entryFree id="n51040" type="main" key="virdi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, sync. for viridicatus, q. v.</entryFree>
virdumarus: <entryFree id="n51041" type="main" key="Virdu^ma^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virdŭmărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leader of the Insubres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 10, 41; Fast. Capitol. ap. Grut. 297, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; v. Viridomarus.</sense></entryFree>
virectum: <entryFree id="n51042" type="main" key="vi^rectum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrectum</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrētum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vireo</etym>, <sense id="n51042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place overgrown with grass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a green place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greensward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turf</hi>: viretum, <foreign lang="greek">a)nqw=n to/pos</foreign>, Gloss.; mostly in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">virecta nemorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoena virecta, of Paradise,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latissima, Apol. M. 4, p. 143, 2: patentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 209 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 10, p. 263, 24.—</sense><sense id="n51042.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">greenness</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythidis (i. e. smaragdi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virens: <entryFree id="n51043" type="main" key="vi^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of vireo.—As <sense id="n51043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrentĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">plants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herbage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:8" default="NO">1, 5, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vireo: <entryFree id="n51044" type="main" key="vi^re^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĕo</orth>, <itype>ui, ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n51044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be green</hi> or <hi rend="ital">verdant</hi> (syn. viridor). </sense><sense id="n51044.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia semper virent, alia, hieme nudatā, verno tempore tepefacta frondescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fronde virere novā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo viret uva jugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit> (3, 32), 78: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pubes hederā virente Gaudeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa (montis) pinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:382" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 837</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna musco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa ilicibus virentem Alburnum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora felle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 777</bibl></cit>: metalla Taygeti, of <hi rend="ital">the green Spartan marble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 42, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:76:9" default="NO">9, 76, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51044.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be fresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lively; to flourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bloom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vegetum ingenium vivido pectore vigebat, virebatque integris sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 22, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum virent genua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas populi Romani viruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:22" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut novus serpens ... solet squamā virere recenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virium gloriā virente florere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51045" type="main" key="vi^re^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĕo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bird;</hi> acc. to some, <hi rend="ital">the greenfinch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 292</bibl>. <cb n="VIRG" /></sense></entryFree>
vires: <entryFree id="n51046" type="main" key="vi_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīres</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. vis.</entryFree>
viresco: <entryFree id="n51047" type="main" key="vi^resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n51047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [1. vireo], <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become green</hi> or <hi rend="ital">verdant.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51047.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 394</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 29, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 54" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, 127</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n51047.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shoot forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be developed</hi>, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 63 (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 674</bibl> the correct read. is vigescat; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 757</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n51047.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To flourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi Romani adulescentia, quā maxime viruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:22:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: virescit vulnere virtus, Furius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11, 4</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 188, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viretum: <entryFree id="n51048" type="main" key="vi^re_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrētum</orth>, v. virectum.</entryFree>
virga: <entryFree id="n51049" type="main" key="virga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root varg; v. virgo</etym>, <sense id="n51049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slender green branch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a twig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">switch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rod.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51049.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51049.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 30, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:172" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 19, 112, § 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 266</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 109</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51049.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A graft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 630</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A limetwig</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 474</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A rod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">switch</hi> for flogging, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 24</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for governing horses, etc.: virga quā ad regendum equum usus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:4:5:16" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 4, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis equus umbrā quoque virgae regitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:22:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 22, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 683</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:317" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 317</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the small rods in the fasces of the lictors</hi>, with which criminals were scourged, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62:section=161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62, § 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 44, § 136</bibl>.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, for fasces, as a designation of one of the higher magistrates, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:47" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:66:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 66, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A wand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a staff</hi>, as a support, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:706" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 706</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A magic wand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 278</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 295</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 300</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51049.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A stalk</hi> of the flax-plant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A streak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stripe</hi> in the heavens, <hi rend="ital">a water-gall</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 9</bibl> and 10.—</sense><sense id="n51049.12" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A colored stripe</hi> in a garment: <cit><quote lang="la">purpureae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 269</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51049.13" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A twig</hi> or <hi rend="ital">branch</hi> of the ancestral tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51049.14" n="E" level="2"> Genitalium, = membrum virile, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Anim, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virgator: <entryFree id="n51050" type="hapax" key="virga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>virga</etym>, <sense id="n51050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who beats with rods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a flogger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virgatus: <entryFree id="n51051" type="main" key="virga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n51051.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Made of twigs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">osiers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calathisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 320</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51051.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to virga, II. C.) <hi rend="ital">Striped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:155" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 344" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 344</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 146</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virgato corpore tigris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:148" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nurus,</quote> <trans><tr>in striped garments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:159" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virgetum: <entryFree id="n51052" type="hapax" key="virge_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thicket of rods</hi> or <hi rend="ital">osiers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virgeus: <entryFree id="n51053" type="main" key="virge^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of rods</hi> or <hi rend="ital">twigs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of brushwood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anuli ex myrto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 37, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <trans><tr>of brush set on fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 463</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virgidemia: <entryFree id="n51054" type="main" key="virgi^de_mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭdēmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>formed from virga, after the analogy of vindemia</etym>, <sense id="n51054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harvest of rods</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of stripes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blows</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 22</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 187, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virgiliae: <entryFree id="n51055" type="main" key="Virgi^li^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭlĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. Vergiliae.</entryFree>
virgilianus: <entryFree id="n51056" type="main" key="Virgi^li^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Vergilius.</entryFree>
virgiliocento: <entryFree id="n51057" type="main" key="Virgi^li^o^cento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭlĭŏcento</orth>, v. Vergiliocento.</entryFree>
virgilius: <entryFree id="n51058" type="main" key="Virgi^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭlĭus</orth>, v. Vergilius.</entryFree>
virginal: <entryFree id="n51059" type="main" key="virgi^nal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭnal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, v. virginalis, II.</entryFree>
virginalis: <entryFree id="n51060" type="main" key="virgi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virgo</etym>, <sense id="n51060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a maiden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">virgin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maidenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virgin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virginal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51060.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus, vestitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: modestia, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 11, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 112, 32</bibl>: ploratus, <hi rend="ital">a wailing like a girl</hi>, id. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 21: <cit><quote lang="la">feles,</quote> <trans><tr>a girl-stealer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">virginarius: Fortuna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Venus</tr>, <tr>as the tutelary goddess of maidens</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 91</bibl></cit> (cf. Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 25</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n51060.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭnāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = pudenda muliebria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 14, 14</bibl>; also in the form virginal, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 14, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; and in <number>plur.</number>: virginalia, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 8.</sense></entryFree>
virginarius: <entryFree id="n51061" type="hapax" key="virgi^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to virgins</hi>: feles, <hi rend="ital">virgin-cat</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">virgin-stealer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 9, 14</bibl>; cf. virginalis.</sense></entryFree>
virginensis: <entryFree id="n51062" type="main" key="Virgi^nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭnensis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭnĭensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess that presided over the loosing of the bridal zone</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 11; 6, 9.</sense></entryFree>
virginesvendonides: <entryFree id="n51063" type="main" key="Virgi^nesvendo^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭnesvendŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>comically<cb n="VIRG" />  formed from virgo - vendo</etym>, <sense id="n51063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">virginseller</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 20</bibl> Ritschl.</sense></entryFree>
virgineus: <entryFree id="n51064" type="main" key="virgi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virgo</etym>, <sense id="n51064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a maiden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">virgin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maidenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virgin</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for virginalis): <cit><quote lang="la">figura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:89" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:563" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 563</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 631: facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:323" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 75" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <trans><tr>offered by a maiden</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favilla,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a virgin's funeral pile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gymnasium,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Spartan virgins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit> (4, 13), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">focus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Vesta</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 44; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, ara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:731" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 731</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Vestals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:71:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 71, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginea domitus sagittā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Danaides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:67" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Amazons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:134" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helicon, as the seat of the Muses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>the golden crown received by the victor at the festival of Minerva</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:23:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Harpies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 216</bibl></cit>: aqua, <hi rend="ital">the aqueduct called</hi> Aqua Virgo (v. virgo, D.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:464" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 464</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also virgineus liquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 8, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virginia: <entryFree id="n51065" type="main" key="Virgi_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgīnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Verginius.</entryFree>
virginitas: <entryFree id="n51066" type="main" key="virgi^ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>virgo</etym>, <sense id="n51066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">maidenhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virginity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 487</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 695</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 95, § 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 292</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:449" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 449</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 160, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51066.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr. = virgines (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">adulta virginitas castitasque nuptarum flens ultima ducebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virginius: <entryFree id="n51067" type="main" key="Virgi_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, v. Verginius.</entryFree>
virginor: <entryFree id="n51068" type="hapax" key="virgi^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>virgo</etym>, <sense id="n51068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to act</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behave like a virgin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to play the virgin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
virgo: <entryFree id="n51069" type="main" key="virgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root varg-; Sanscr. ūrg, strength, ūrga-jami, nourish; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)rga/w</foreign>, to swell, <foreign lang="greek">o)rgh/</foreign>, impulse</etym>, <sense id="n51069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maiden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virgin</hi> (cf. puella). </sense><sense id="n51069.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51069.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Sabinas honesto ortas loco virgines rapi jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oratio philosophorum) casta, verecunda, virgo incorrupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellica,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pallas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:754" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 754</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:459" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 459</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturnia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Vesta</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:383" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vestalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 10, 17</bibl>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl></cit>: dea, <hi rend="ital">the virgin goddess</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:92:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 92, 8</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of female animals that have not coupled, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 41, § 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:357" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:56:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 56, 1</bibl></cit>.—Adject.: <cit><quote lang="la">carnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 10, § 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">equa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">buculae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 224</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51069.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of particular virgins.—Of a <hi rend="ital">Vestal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui esset decimus annus post Virginum absolutionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines sanctae,</quote> <trans><tr>the Vestals</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.— Of <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 22, 1</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the Danaides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 26</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">Astrœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51069.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51069.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., of young females, <hi rend="ital">a young woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">girl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:435" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 435</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:38" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51069.6" n="B" level="2"> In the eccl. fathers, of males, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 22, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 22, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51069.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation</hi> Virgo <hi rend="ital">in the zodiac</hi>, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 110; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:25" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3:24" default="NO">3, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51069.8" n="D" level="2"> Aqua Virgo, or simply Virgo, <hi rend="ital">a stream of cold water brought to Rome in an aqueduct constructed by M. Agrippa</hi> (so called because a young girl discovered its source), now <hi rend="ital">Fontana Trevi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 10" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 25, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 385</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 42, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:47:6" default="NO">11, 47, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:163:2 al" default="NO">14, 163, 2 al.</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 1, p. 703 sq.—</sense><sense id="n51069.9" n="E" level="2"> Of things; as an adjectival appellative for <hi rend="ital">unwedded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unused</hi> (mostly post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">senecta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unmarried</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saliva,</quote> <trans><tr>fasting</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jejun. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>untilled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 15, § 52</bibl></cit>: charta, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that has not been read</hi> or <hi rend="ital">published</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:67:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 67, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">EMIT ET COMPARAVIT LOCVM VIRGINEM,</quote> <trans><tr>vacant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4566</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virgosus: <entryFree id="n51070" type="main" key="virgo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virga</etym>, <sense id="n51070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of twigs</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">frutex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
virgula: <entryFree id="n51071" type="main" key="virgu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little twig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small rod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina,</quote> <trans><tr>a divining-rod</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 158</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work by Varro</hi>, ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 550, 12</bibl>: censoria, <hi rend="ital">a critical mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a sign of spuriousness</hi> (i. q. obelus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">an</hi> <pb n="1996" /> <cb n="VIRI" /> <hi rend="ital">accentual mark</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 273</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a stripe</hi> on a garment, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:207" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 207</bibl>.— Of <hi rend="ital">a slight column</hi> of smoke, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virgulatus: <entryFree id="n51072" type="hapax" key="virgu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virgula</etym>, <sense id="n51072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">striped</hi> (cf. virga, II. C., and virgatus, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">concha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virgultum: <entryFree id="n51073" type="main" key="virgultum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgultum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from virguletum, from virgula</etym> (only in <number>plur.</number>), <sense id="n51073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thicket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrubbery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 18, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:E. 10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:A. 5:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 661</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 349</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:90" default="NO">11, 2, 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51073.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Slips</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cuttings</hi> of trees: <cit><quote lang="la">defodere in terram virgulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:933" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 933</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 346</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virgultus: <entryFree id="n51074" type="main" key="virgultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virgultum</etym>, <sense id="n51074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of bushes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thickets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrubby</hi>: vallis, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 516</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:354" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 354</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virguncula: <entryFree id="n51075" type="main" key="virguncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virguncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>virgo</etym>, <sense id="n51075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little maid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young girl</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:17:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 17, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 40</bibl>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">virguncula puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 10" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viriae: <entryFree id="n51076" type="main" key="vi^ri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of ornament for the arm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">armlets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bracelets</hi> (syn. armilla), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 12, § 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Abrah. 1, 9, 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viriathus: <entryFree id="n51077" type="main" key="Vi^ri^a_thus" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭrĭāthus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭrĭātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated leader of the Lusitanians in the war against the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:54" default="NO" valid="yes">54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:90:3" default="NO">2, 90, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:354" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 354</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:219" default="NO">10, 219</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭrĭāthīnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭrĭātīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Viriathus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viriatus: <entryFree id="n51078" type="main" key="vi^ri^a_tus" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>viriae</etym>, <sense id="n51078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adorned with bracelets</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 186, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. p. 187:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. p. 187, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viriculae: <entryFree id="n51079" type="hapax" key="vi_ri^cu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīrĭcŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>vires, from vis</etym>, <sense id="n51079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small force</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonii,</quote> <trans><tr>small means</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 271, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viriculum: <entryFree id="n51080" type="main" key="vi_ri^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīrĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n51080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a graving-tool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burin</hi>, = cestrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 41, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viridarium: <entryFree id="n51081" type="main" key="vi^ri^da_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdārĭum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>and</itype>, contr., <orth extent="full" lang="la">virdĭārĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>viridis</etym>, <sense id="n51081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plantation of trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pleasure-garden</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 2, 2, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:26" default="NO">33, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 23 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
viride: <entryFree id="n51082" type="main" key="vi^ri^de^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. viridis <sense id="n51082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
viridesco: <entryFree id="n51083" type="main" key="vi^ri^desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n51083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [viridis], <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become green</hi>, Ambros. Hexaëm. 5, 1, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spir. Sanc. prol. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viridia: <entryFree id="n51084" type="main" key="vi^ri^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. viridis, B. 2.</entryFree>
viridiarium: <entryFree id="n51085" type="main" key="vi^ri^di^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. viridarium <sense id="n51085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
viridicans: <entryFree id="n51086" type="main" key="vi^ri^di^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [viridis], <sense id="n51086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greenish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavositates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viridicatus: <entryFree id="n51087" type="main" key="vi^ri^di^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [id.], <sense id="n51087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">green</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit> dub.; v. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (Bait. virdicata).</sense></entryFree>
viridis: <entryFree id="n51088" type="main" key="vi^ri^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n51088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> viridum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:279" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 279</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vireo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">green.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51088.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (as the most general designation for every shade of that color). </sense><sense id="n51088.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 805</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 322</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">colles nitidissimi viridissimique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridis opacaque ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridiores herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridia atque umida ligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:17:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colubrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nereidum comae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 28, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: caelum, <hi rend="ital">bluish green</hi> (when it is clear), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 14, § 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51088.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭde</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n51088.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Green color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verdure</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">bacis e viridi rubentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>reddish green</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 127</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">e viridi pallens (gemma),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 33, § 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51088.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A green thing</hi>, of plants, trees, etc. (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 43, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne viride agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, 16</bibl></cit>.—More freq. <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">green plants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herbs</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">trees</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 14</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51088.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">youthful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blooming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridiora praemiorum genera (opp. arescentes laureae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:8:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:22" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridis et adhuc dulcis fructus studiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl></cit> 6, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">indignantium, tam viridem et in flore aetatis ereptum esse rebus humanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus earum (litterarum) viridior vegetiorque,</quote> <trans><tr>livelier and stronger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cb n="VIRI" /> firmior et viridior sonus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 20, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euryalus formā insignis viridique juventā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 304</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:187" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 187</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Col. praef. § 12: usque ad novissimam valetudinem viridis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:742" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 742</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex, sed mehercule viridis animo ac vigens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio viridis, sed belli serus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:255" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 255</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridissimus irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:569" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 569</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĕ</orth>, <hi rend="ital">greenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verdantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil omnino viridius comparatum illis (smaragdis) viret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 16, § 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viriditas: <entryFree id="n51089" type="main" key="vi^ri^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>viridis</etym>, <sense id="n51089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">green color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verdure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viridity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51089.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbescens viriditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pratorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 76</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51089.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">freshness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briskness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus aufert eam viriditatem, in quā etiam nunc erat Scipio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigere et habere quandam viriditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurea illa amittit longo intervallo viriditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 12, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virido: <entryFree id="n51090" type="main" key="vi^ri^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n51090.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to grow green</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:136" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada subnatis viridentur ab herbis,</quote> <trans><tr>become green</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:90" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 90</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n51090.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, in the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi> viridans, <hi rend="ital">growing green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verdant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingit viridanti tempora lauro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1396" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1396</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 117</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proximus ut viridante toro consederat herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 388</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 34, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 785</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viridomarus: <entryFree id="n51091" type="main" key="Viridoma^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Viridomărus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Virdum-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief of the Ædui</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:10:41" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 10, 41</bibl> (called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Virdomărus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 20</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
virilis: <entryFree id="n51092" type="main" key="vi^ri_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vir</etym>, <sense id="n51092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virile</hi> (cf.: mas, masculus). </sense><sense id="n51092.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51092.2" n="A" level="2"> In respect of sex, <hi rend="ital">male</hi>, <hi rend="ital">masculine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51092.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: virile et muliebre secus, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virile secus, i. e. puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps fratris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:189" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coetus,</quote> <trans><tr>of men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:403" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 403</bibl></cit>; cf. balnea, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <trans><tr>the love of a man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 282</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51092.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51092.5" n="a" level="4"> In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1209</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 11, 2</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrī-lia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = membrum virile, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 16, 61, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:243" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 22, 89, § 243</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui viriliores videbantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n51092.6" n="b" level="4"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">of the masculine gender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">masculine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10</bibl></cit>, §§ 21 and 30 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:4 al" default="NO">11, 1, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51092.7" n="B" level="2"> In respect of strength, vigor, etc., <hi rend="ital">manly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full-grown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrived at the years of manhood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conversis studiis aetas animusque virilis Quaerit opes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne forte seniles Mandentur juveni partes pueroque viriles,</quote> <trans><tr>the parts of fullgrown men</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars magna domus tuae morietur cum ad virilem aetatem venerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <trans><tr>assumed by Roman youth in their sixteenth year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 69, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 34, 4 al.</bibl>—Opp. to female garments: <cit><quote lang="la">sumpsisti virilem togam quam statim muliebrem stolam reddidisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51092.8" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that falls to a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to each one</hi> in the division of inheritances: ut ex bonis ejus, qui, etc., virilis pars patrono debeatur, <hi rend="ital">a proportionate part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an equal share</hi> with others, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota bona pro virilibus partibus ad liberos defuncti pertinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:54:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 54, § 3</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">virilis portio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:5:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 37, 5, 8</bibl></cit> pr.; 31, 1, 70, § 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51092.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n51092.10" n="(a)" level="5"> Virilis pars or portio, <hi rend="ital">share</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lot</hi> of a person: <cit><quote lang="la">est aliqua mea pars virilis, quod ejus civitatis sum, quam ille claram reddidit,</quote> <trans><tr>my part</tr>, <tr>my duty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:37:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 37, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus quam pars virilis postulat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">7: cum illius gloriae pars virilis apud omnes milites sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem agrum miles pro parte virili manu cepisset, eum senex quoque vindicaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:71:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 71, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec qui pro virili parte defendunt, optimates sunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to the utmost of their ability</tr>, <tr>as far as in them lies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 66, 138</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pro virili parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro parte virili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 8, 4</bibl></cit>;
