Ov. <cb n="VIRO" /> Tr. 5, 11, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">pro virili portione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51092.11" n="(b)" level="5"> In other connections (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">actoris partis chorus officiumque virile Defendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 193</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc. —</sense><sense id="n51092.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of quality, <hi rend="ital">worthy of a man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spirited</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">veretur quicquam aut facere aut loqui, quod parum virile videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterum inflexio fortis ac virilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinatio laterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta illa res est animo virili, consilio puerili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis ingenii (with solida),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:24" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio (with fortis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 231</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">compositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio atque sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:10:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim oratorius iste, immo hercle ne virilis quidem cultus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 26</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrīlia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">manly deeds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 15</bibl> Dietsch.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: ALMIAE SABINAE MATRI VIRILISSIMAE, etc., Inscr. Grud. p. 148, n. 5.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrīlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">manfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courageously</hi> (acc. to II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 27, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 11, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:479" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 479</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.,</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virilitas: <entryFree id="n51093" type="main" key="vi^ri_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrīlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>virilis</etym>, <sense id="n51093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">manhood</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n51093.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51093.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The age of manhood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 155</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51093.3" n="B" level="2"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">manhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaiam C. Caesarem, quasi incertae virilitatis, dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adempta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51093.4" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the organs of generation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 4, 3, § 36</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:7:5 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 7, 5 al.</bibl>—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:26:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 26, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 44</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n51093.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">manliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manly vigor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctitas certe. et, ut sic dicam, virilitas ab his (veteribus Latinis) petenda, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viriliter: <entryFree id="n51094" type="main" key="vi^ri_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrīlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. virilis <sense id="n51094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
viriola: <entryFree id="n51095" type="main" key="vi^ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>viriae</etym>, <sense id="n51095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bracelet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 12, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:40" default="NO">34, 2, 40</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viriose: <entryFree id="n51096" type="main" key="vi^ri^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>viriosus</etym>, <sense id="n51096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
viriosus: <entryFree id="n51097" type="main" key="vi^ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vis</etym>, <sense id="n51097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">robust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitia usu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 16 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 196</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
viriplaca: <entryFree id="n51098" type="main" key="Vi^ri^pla_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭrĭplāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vir-placo</etym>, a name of the goddess (Juno) who, in her temple on the Palatine Hill, reconciles husbands to their wives, <sense id="n51098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">appeaser of men</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viripotens: <entryFree id="n51099" type="hapax" key="vi_ri^po^tens1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīrĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vis-potior</etym>, <sense id="n51099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mighty in power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, an epithet of Jupiter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51100" type="main" key="vi^ri^po^tens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vir-potior</etym>, <sense id="n51100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fit for a husband</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">marriageable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nubile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:65" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:58" default="NO">26, 7, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:99" default="NO">35, 1, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viritanus: <entryFree id="n51101" type="gloss" key="vi^ri_ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrītānus</orth> <itype>ager dicitur, qui viritim populo distribuitur</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
viritim: <entryFree id="n51102" type="main" key="vi^ri_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrītim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>vir</etym>, <sense id="n51102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">man by man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to each one separately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">individually</hi> (used only with distrib. numerals, never with card.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>). </sense><sense id="n51102.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viritim dicitur dari, quod datur per singulos viros. Cato: praeda, quae capta est, viritim divisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=378" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 378</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui legem de agro Gallico viritim dividendo tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viritim dispertire aliquid populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distribuere pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare tricenos nummos cohortibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi viritim deleti,</quote> <trans><tr>one and all</tr>, <tr>all together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51102.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">each by itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">individually</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">in universum de ventis diximus: nunc viritim incipiamus illos discutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">possum donare sapienti, quod viritim meum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his, quae viritim ei serviunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 7:7:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commonefacere beneficii sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 4</bibl></cit>: prompta studia, <hi rend="ital">separately</hi> (with nondum aperta consensione), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legere terereque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viromandui: <entryFree id="n51103" type="main" key="Vi_romandu^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vīromandŭi</orth>, v. Veromandui.</entryFree>
viror: <entryFree id="n51104" type="main" key="vi^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭror</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vireo</etym>, <sense id="n51104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">green color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verdure</hi> (post-class. for viriditas): <cit><quote lang="la">pratorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 348, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superest aliquid de virore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virosus: <entryFree id="n51105" type="main" key="vi^ro_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vir</etym>, <sense id="n51105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fond of men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longing after men</hi>: uxor, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 21, 30</bibl>; Afran. ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 223</bibl> <pb n="1997" /> <cb n="VIRU" /> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: qui non modo vinosus, sed virosus quoque sit, Scipio Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51106" type="main" key="vi_ro_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virus</etym>. <sense id="n51106.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covered with slime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slimy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 257, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 21</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum adversus stomachum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 103" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51106.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Having a bad odor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virosi odoris sordes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 163" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castorea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 223</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eluvies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>urine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 355</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51106.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Poisonous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51106.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 196</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 332</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51106.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures mariti virosa susurronum faece completae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
virtuosus: <entryFree id="n51107" type="main" key="virtu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virtŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virtus</etym>, <sense id="n51107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">virtuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. c. Sec. Man. 10.</sense></entryFree>
virtus: <entryFree id="n51108" type="main" key="virtu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virtūs</orth>, <itype>ūtis</itype> (<sense id="n51108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> virtutium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 10, 34</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case> VIRTVTEI, Inscr. Corp. Lat. 1, 30 and 34), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vir</etym>, <hi rend="ital">manliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manhood</hi>, i. e. the sum of all the corporeal or mental excellences of man, <hi rend="ital">strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor; bravery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courage; aptness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capacity; worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus clara aeternaque habetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni virtus fidesque vostra spectata mihi forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 74:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 74, 1</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n51108.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n51108.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fiet, ut animi virtus corporis virtuti anteponatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his virtutibus ornatus, modestiā, temperantiā, justitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes continentiae, gravitatis, justitiae, fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus atque integritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoris vis divina virtusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51108.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals, and of inanimate or abstract things, <hi rend="ital">goodness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strength</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam nec arboris, nec equi virtus (in quo abutimur nomine) in opinione sita est, sed in naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:16:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 16, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedium-solo bono, suā virtute valeat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merci pretium statui, pro virtute ut veneat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:13:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoriae virtutes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 17, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio habet virtutes tres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi (opp. vitium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">17: facundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51108.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51108.5" n="A" level="2"> In the phrase deūm virtute, usu. with dicam, <hi rend="ital">by the aid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">merit of the gods</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the gods be thanked</hi> (anteclass), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtute deūm et majorum nostrūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 71</bibl> dub.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 85</bibl> and 90; <cit><quote lang="la">so virtute eorum (i. e. majorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51108.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Moral perfection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtuousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51108.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">est autem virtus nihil aliud quam in se perfecta et ad summum perducta natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus est animi habitus naturae modo rationi consentaneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnes rectae animi affectiones virtutes appellentur ... Appellata est ex viro virtus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:18:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 18, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero habere virtutem satis est quasi artem aliquam, nisi utare ... virtus in usu sui tota posita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est in eo virtus et probitas et summum officium summaque observantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 28</bibl></cit>, a, 2.—</sense><sense id="n51108.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Virtue</hi>, personified as a deity, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 13, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 25, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:115 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 115 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51108.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Military talents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bravery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gallantry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortitude</hi> (syn. fortitudo), etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetii reliquos Gallos virtute praecedunt, quod fere cottidianis proeliis cum Germanis contendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 13: militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:62:1" default="NO" valid="yes">62, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudi virtute Neronis Armenius cecidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipiadae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 9, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 7, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51108.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Obstinacy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virulentia: <entryFree id="n51109" type="main" key="vi_ru^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīrŭlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>virulentus</etym>, <sense id="n51109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an offensive odor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stench</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hircorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
virulentus: <entryFree id="n51110" type="main" key="vi_ru^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīrŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virus</etym>, <sense id="n51110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of poison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poisonous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virulent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virunum: <entryFree id="n51111" type="main" key="viru_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virūnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n51111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Noricum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 24, 27, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virus: <entryFree id="n51112" type="main" key="vi_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. visham; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)o/s</foreign>, poison</etym>, <sense id="n51112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slimy liquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slime.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51112.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., of animals and plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 281</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 27, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:45" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 6, 15, § 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:104" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 104</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">animal sperm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">semen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 50, 74, § 157</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51112.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in a bad sense. </sense><sense id="n51112.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A poisonous liquid</hi>, <cb n="VIS" /> <hi rend="ital">poison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virus</hi> (syn. venenum). </sense><sense id="n51112.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=432" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 419</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:64" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 17, 48, § 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amatorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 22, 34, § 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51112.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">evomere virus acerbitatis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futile virus linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:560" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:476" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 476</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51112.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An offensive odor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stench</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:853" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 853</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 115, § 277</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:107" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 83, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:185" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 15, 52, § 185</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odoris,</quote> <trans><tr>an offensive pungency</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 3, 6, § 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:79" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 7, 23, § 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51112.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saline taste;</hi> of sea-water, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 476</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:269" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 269</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:635" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 635</bibl>.—Of wine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vis: <entryFree id="n51113" type="main" key="vi_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīs</orth>, <itype>vis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <number>plur.</number> vīres, ĭum (class. only in <case>nom.</case>, <case>acc.</case> and <sense id="n51113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> and in <hi rend="ital">plur.; gen. sing.</hi> very rare; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 30</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dat. sing.</hi> vi, Auct. B. Afr. 69, 2; C. I. L. 5, 837; collat. form of the <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> vis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 265</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:586" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 586</bibl>; Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 707</bibl>, or H. 3, 62 Dietsch; Messala ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 9, 14</bibl>) [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)/s, vis</foreign>, sinew, force; <foreign lang="greek">i)=fi</foreign>, with might], <hi rend="ital">strength</hi>, physical or mental; <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">energy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi> (cf. robur). </sense><sense id="n51113.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51113.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n51113.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritas et vis equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:70:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 70, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna vis eorum (urorum) et magna velocitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra vim atque impetum fluminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 326</bibl></cit> (301): <cit><quote lang="la">horrida teli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acris vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri aerisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24, 58</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n51113.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (most freq. of physical strength): <cit><quote lang="la">non viribus aut velocitatibus aut celeritate corporum res magnae geruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nunc vires desidero adulescentis, non plus quam adulescens tauri aut elephanti desiderabam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ali vires nervosque confirmari putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me jam sanguis viresque deficiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 50</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpauci viribus confisi transnatare contenderunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri integris viribus fortiter repugnare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertis et viribus pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus viribus atque opibus repugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:11:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non animi solum vigore sed etiam corporis viribus excellens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validis viribus hastam contorquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid agas, decet agere pro viribus,</quote> <trans><tr>with all your might</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">supra vires,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et neglecta solent incendia sumere vires,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu virium vi seu exercitatione multā cibi vinique capacissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in proelii concursu abit res a Consilio ad vires vimque pugnantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 1, 4</bibl></cit> dub. (Siebel. vires usumque).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mihi sunt vires inimicos pellere tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51113.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51113.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Energy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potency</hi> (of herbs, drugs, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">in radices vires oleae abibunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 61, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires habet herba?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:942" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 942</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregius fons Viribus occultis adjuvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:42" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 42</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51113.7" n="b" level="4"> Vis, personified, the same as <hi rend="ital">Juno</hi>, Aus. Idyll. de Deis; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 432</bibl> Serv. —</sense><sense id="n51113.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Hostile strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">bi/a</foreign>: EA POENA, QVAE EST DE VI, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vi vis illata defenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">celeri rumore dilato Dioni vim allatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vim facias ullam in illam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine vi facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim afferre alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 21, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 66, § 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 30, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidio tam valido et armato vim adferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter per vim tentare,</quote> <trans><tr>by force</tr>, <tr>forcibly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">per vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne id quidem satis est, nisi docet, ita se possedisse nec vi nec clam nec precario possederit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:32:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 32, 92</bibl></cit>; so the jurid. formula in Lex Thoria ap. Grut. 202, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis haec quidem hercle est, et trahi et trudi simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves totae factae ex robore ad quamvis vim et contumeliam perferendam (shortly afterwards: tantas tempestates Oceani tantosque impetus ventorum sustineri),</quote> <trans><tr>violence</tr>, <tr>shock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <trans><tr>a storm</tr>, <tr>tempest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 69, § 278</bibl></cit>.—To avoid the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> form (v. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">de vi condemnati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: de vi reus; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:35:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 35, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 17, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei qui de vi itemque ei qui majestatis damnatus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 21</bibl> sq. Halm ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51113.9" n="d" level="4"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>: pudicitiam cum eriperet militi tribunus militaris ... interfectus ab eo est, <cb n="VISC" /> cui vim adferebat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matribus familias vim attulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis allata sorori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victa nitore dei vim passa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim passa est Phoebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 679</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51113.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr. </sense><sense id="n51113.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Quantity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi> (cf.: copia, multitudo); with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi retruderet hominum me vis invitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innumerabilis servorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pompā cum magna vis auri argentique ferretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis magna pulveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis maxima ranunculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim lacrimarum profudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:14:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odora canum vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nescio quomodo is, qui auctoritatem minimam habet, maximam vim, populus cum illis facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51113.12" n="2" level="3"> Vires, <hi rend="ital">military forces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troops</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeesse exercitui, ut praeter auctoritatem vires quoque ad coërcendum haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis virium ad certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 60, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique contractis viribus signa cum Papirio conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur omne virium ejus regni,</quote> <trans><tr>the flower</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitet et vires Graecia magna suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 340.—</sense><sense id="n51113.13" n="3" level="3"> Vires, <hi rend="ital">the virile forces</hi> or <hi rend="ital">organs</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 158</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 163</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2322</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2332</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veluti castratis viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vis (= vires) multas possidere in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 586</bibl></cit>.—Rarely <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis genitalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51113.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51113.15" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Mental strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis illa divina et virtus oratoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis ac facultas oratoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavitatem Isocrates ... sonitum Aeschines, vim Demosthenes habuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna vis est conscientiae in utramque partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 23, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna vis est in fortunā in utramque partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ostentum habuit hanc vim, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>power</tr>, <tr>effect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 33, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui indignitate suā vim ac jus magistratui quem gerebat dempsisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus conventionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:25:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 25, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:32" default="NO">12, 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51113.16" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">import</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">essence</hi> (cf. significatio): <cit><quote lang="la">id, in quo est omnis vis amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae vis et natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:31:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 31, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis honesti (with natura),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae est alia vis legis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis, natura, genera verborum et simplicium et copulatorum,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>the sense</tr>, <tr>signification</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 32, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis verbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:13:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 13, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 8, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vis insit in his paucis verbis, si attendes, si attendes, intelleges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vis subjecta sit vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">metwnumi/a</foreign>, cujus vis est, pro eo, quod dicitur, causam, propter quam dicitur, ponere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viscatorium: <entryFree id="n51114" type="main" key="visca_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>visco</etym>, <sense id="n51114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a snare</hi> (late Lat.), Manich. Cit. Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 3, 74.</sense></entryFree>
viscatus: <entryFree id="n51115" type="main" key="visca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [id.], <sense id="n51115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smeared with birdlime</hi>: virgae, <hi rend="ital">limed twigs.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51115.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 474</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 391</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51115.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: omnia viscatis manibus leget, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 332, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">396, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51115.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscata beneficia devitare,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>entangling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>for which one expects a good return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 30, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viscellatus: <entryFree id="n51116" type="main" key="viscella_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscellātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. viscus</etym>, <sense id="n51116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stuffed with the entrails</hi> of fishes or of birds: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
viscellinus: <entryFree id="n51117" type="main" key="Viscelli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Viscellīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an agnomen of the consul</hi> Sp. Cassius, <hi rend="ital">who was put to death for aiming at the sovereignty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 36</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
visceratim: <entryFree id="n51118" type="hapax" key="visce^ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscĕrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>1. viscus</etym>, <sense id="n51118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">piecemeal</hi>: dissupat membra, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 183, 17</bibl> (Trag. v. 145 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
visceratio: <entryFree id="n51119" type="main" key="visce^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public distribution of flesh</hi> cr <hi rend="ital">mcat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:46" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3858</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine amico visceratio, leonis ac lupi vita est,</quote> <trans><tr>a feeding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 19:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 19, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viscereus: <entryFree id="n51120" type="main" key="visce^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscĕrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of flesh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arvum nondum viscereum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>which had not yet been employed in the creation of man</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1093</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1998" /> <cb n="VISI" /></sense></entryFree>
viscidus: <entryFree id="n51121" type="main" key="visci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>viscum</etym>, <sense id="n51121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clammy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sticky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viscid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6</bibl>: viscidiores cibi, id. de Diaeta, 18.</sense></entryFree>
visco: <entryFree id="n51122" type="main" key="visco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">visco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n51122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besmear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se inter articulorum conjunctiones usu commotionum viscaverit (sanies),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirat et hinc miseri viscantur labra mariti,</quote> <trans><tr>are glued</tr>, <tr>smeared</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:463" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 463</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viscosus: <entryFree id="n51123" type="main" key="visco_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>viscum</etym>, <sense id="n51123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of birdlime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sticky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viscous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 824</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viscum: <entryFree id="n51124" type="main" key="viscum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">viscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 16</bibl>) [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)co/s, vicos</foreign>; Lat. viscus], <sense id="n51124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mistletoe.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51124.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 94, § 248</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 4, 6, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 205</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51124.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">birdlime</hi> made from the berries of the mistletoe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:263" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 11, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51124.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscus merus vestra est blanditia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactus sum vehementer visco: cor stimulo foditur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with love</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viscus: <entryFree id="n51125" type="main" key="viscus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, and more freq. in the <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">viscĕra</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prop. the soft parts; cf.: viscum, viscidus</etym>, <sense id="n51125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inner parts</hi> of the animal body, <hi rend="ital">the internal organs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the inwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viscera</hi> (the nobler parts, the heart, lungs, liver, as well as the ignobler, the stomach, entrails, etc.; cf.: ilia, intestina, exta). </sense><sense id="n51125.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: mortui praecordia et viscus omne, Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 837</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:719" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 719</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:76" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 290</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 365</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 658</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 139</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51125.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (only so in class. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 669</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:249" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:375 al" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 375 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 601</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 846</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 390</bibl>; 15, 314; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:205 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 205 al.</bibl>—Of <hi rend="ital">the uterus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 8</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the testicles</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 142</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51125.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51125.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The flesh</hi>, as lying under the skin: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Herculi Dejanira sanguine Centauri tinctam tunicam induisset, inhaesissetque ea visceribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: ut multus e visceribus sanguis exeat, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 14, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu quantum scelus est, in viscera viscera condi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 253</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 180</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51125.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The fruit of the womb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">child</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">(Tereus) in suam sua viscera congerit alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 651</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 478</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 465</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 118</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera sua flammis inicere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>one's own writings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, praef. § 3 Spald.—</sense><sense id="n51125.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, like our <hi rend="ital">bowels</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">the interior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inward</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inmost part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itum est in viscera terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montis (Aetnae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 575</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medullis populi Romani ac visceribus haerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in venis atque in visceribus rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in dicendo non extrinsecus alicunde quaerenda, sed ex ipsis visceribus causae sumenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 318</bibl></cit>: quae (<foreign lang="greek">e)gkeleu/smata</foreign>) mihi in visceribus haerent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu patriae validas in viscera vertite vires,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>her own citizens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:833" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 833</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de visceribus tuis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from your means</tr>, <tr>property</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aerarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: magnarum domuum, <hi rend="ital">the heart</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the favorite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51126" type="main" key="viscus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. viscum <sense id="n51126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
visibilis: <entryFree id="n51127" type="main" key="vi_si^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>video</etym>. <sense id="n51127.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that may be seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visible</hi> (late Lat. for adspectabilis): exhalationes tenues vixque visibiles, App. de Mundo, p. 60, 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:de Deo Socr. p. 42:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 42, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cath. 5, 158</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n51127.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that can see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seeing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 146</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsĭbĭlĭter</orth> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">visibly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
visibilitas: <entryFree id="n51128" type="main" key="vi_si^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>visibilis, I.</etym>, <sense id="n51128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">visibility</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Fulg. ap. Contin. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> p. 750</bibl> Stav.</sense></entryFree>
visibiliter: <entryFree id="n51129" type="main" key="vi_si^bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. visibilis <sense id="n51129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
